loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie B. is from the village of Baliangao. She is 44 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lenie owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling of dry goods in the local community. Lenie has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,900 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for the store. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lenie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for the store

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Mrs. Lenie P. is from the neighbourhood of P2 Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years of age, married to Angel P. an OFW.  She is blessed with 5 children who are now at their school age. To earn a living, she is presently engaged in operating a Sari-sari store and a direct selling business for AVON and NATASHA Products. She is also receiving support from her husband. She has been engaged in the Sari-sari store business for 10 years and 5 years for AVON and NATASHA Products. She earns approximately 2,500 Php a month with these business activities. 

Just this year, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenie as a newly recognized member under the PDP-LP, a micro finance program of PMPC, is now requesting a loan of 5,000 Php. This is her 1st loan and to be used for additional capital for her Sari-sari Store and AVON / NATASHA direct selling business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, insurances, children’s education and possible business expansions. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari Store and Direct Selling for AVON and NATASHA Products

location.town: P2 Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, M

loans.name: Esterlita Bautista's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Esterlita B. is 49 years of age, married and a resident of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  Esterlita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Esterlita B.’s Group.

Esterlita is married to George Rommel B. who is an office encoder. They were blessed with 2 school aged children. To help her husband, she decided to engage in rice retailing and jewelry selling business.  For 25 years, she was able to maintain this business  activity and she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,500.00 a month in which is so helpful with their family income. 

Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC for being one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and winning the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006 she decided to join the cooperative in the year 2009. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reached out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of P8,000.00 as her 3rd cycle loan to be used for additional capital for her existing rice retailing and jewelry dealing business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, loan repayments to PMPC, children’s education and for possible business expansions.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice retailing and jewelry selling business

loans.name: Banah's Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 1 est un regroupement composé de huit femmes toutes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, ayant un âge moyen de 56 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de N’Gama dans la commune rurale de N’Gara dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali, qu’est Ségou. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et cultivent l’arachide, le mil et le riz.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs champs de riz pendant l’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Madame Bassouma D.  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de complexe céréale et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour, de repiquage  et de sarclage dans son champ de riz. 
Il est à noter que dans ce village N’Gama, les activités de labour et de sarclage des champs sont l’œuvre des hommes alors que le repiquage et le désherbage du riz sont effectués par les associations de femmes du village. 
Bassouma D. se ravitaille en engrais à la foire de Konodimini auprès des grossistes. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle compte réaliser  20 sacs de riz.  
Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Benkadi 1 is a group of eight women who are all married and live in traditional households; they are around 56 years old and have four children each. They all live in N'Gama village in Segou, the fourth largest administrative building in Mali, and met each other through family and friends; they cultivate peanuts, millet and rice. In order to enlarge their rice fields they are seeking a second loan from Soro Yiriwaso. Madame Bassouma D. aims to use her loan both to purchase three bags of complex cereals and to hire some staff in order to cultivate, pick and hoe the rice fields. In N'Gama village, labour and picking the fields is generally men's work, whereas weeding the rice is done by women's associations in the village. Bassouma D. sources her fertiliser from wholesalers at the Konodimini market. She aims to utilise her 2 hectar land in order to generate 20 bags of rice. Part of the harvest is consumed by those involved in its production, and the rest is sold. The profits generated are used to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertiliser and employ labour

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 2 est composé de dix femmes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont un âge moyen de 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de N’Gama dans la commune rurale de N’Gara dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali, qu’est Ségou. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et font la culture de l’arachide, du mil et du riz. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants disponibles en début de la saison des pluies, les membres du groupe ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Madame Djènè B., qui fait non seulement le riz mais aussi l’arachide, compte acheter avec son prêt, 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 30 kg de grains d’arachide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour, de repiquage et de sarclage dans ses champs. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Konodimini. 
Les activités de labour et de sarclage de son champ d’arachide seront fait par les hommes alors que le repiquage et le désherbage du riz reviendront aux femmes du village. 
Avec une superficie totale de 2 hectares, elle compte réaliser 10 sacs d’arachide, 20 sacs de riz. 
Une partie de la récolte  du riz est auto consommée tandis que le reste et l’arachide sont vendus. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer et l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
Benkadi 2 is made up of ten married women who live in large extended families. They are 47 years old and have 4 children each and live in the N'Gama village in Segou, the fourth largest administrative region of Mali. They met through family and friends, and grow peanuts, millet and rice for a living. In order to have all the necessary materials ready at the beginning of the rainy season, the group's members are seeking a second loan from Soro Yiriwaso. Madame Djènè B. who grows not only rice but also peanuts, aims to use the loan to purchase three bags of complex cereal, 30kg of peanut seeds and to employ staff to work, pick and hoe the fields. She sources her raw materials from the Konodimini market. The work and hoeing will be done by men, whereas the picking and weeding of the rice will be done by the village women. With a total area of 2 hectars, she aims to generate 10 bags of peanuts and 20 bags of rice. Some of the rice harvest will be consumed by those that were involved in its production, and the rest will be sold along with the peanuts. The profits generated will be used to see to family needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertiliser, peanut seeds and labour costs

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 3 est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans le village de N’Gama dans la commune rurale de N’Gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et  font essentiellement la culture de l’arachide et du riz.
Dans le but de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles,  les membres du groupe ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Madame Founé C.  qui est la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 25 kg de semence d’arachide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour  son  champ.  Elle se ravitaille semence d’arachide à la foire de Konodimini. 
Elle compte réaliser 40 sacs d’arachide sur sa parcelle de  2 hectares. 
Une partie de la  production est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer et les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Benkadi 3 is made up of four women, all of whom are married and live in large traditional families. They are 48 years old with four children on average. They live in the N'Gama village in Segou (the fourth largest administrative region of Mali). They met through friends and family, and primarily grow peanuts and rice for a living. In order to profit from these agricultural activities, the group members are seeking a second loan from Soro Yiriwaso. Madame Founé C., who is the group's president, aims to use the loan to purchase 25kg of peanut seeds and employ workers for the field. She replenishes her peanut seed stocks at the Konodimini market. She aims to generate 40 bags of peanuts on her 2 hectar plot of land. Some of the harvest will be consumed by those involved in its production and the rest will be sold. The profit generated will be used for household needs and the children's educational costs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peanut seeds and hire workers

loans.name: Hafizahon's Group

texts.en: Aravan village is located in the famous vast Fergana valley, which is a homeland for many nationalities such as Kyrgyzs, Uzbeks, Tajiks and other cultures. It has its own unique and distinguished way of life, customs and mentality. For many centuries, this region has been sought after for colonization by Great Britain and Russia, but now it is a border region between Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan. Hafizahon H. lives in Aravan village. She is 32 and has two children. Both her 14-year-old daughter and 12-year-old son go to the local middle school. Hafizahon and her husband want to give their children quality education. To provide for the family, her husband works as a cook in a local café. As for Hafizahon, she combines several jobs. Hafizahon grows and sells rice, which is the main crop in this region. As well as that, she works as a nurse in a kindergarten and also sells gold jewelry and clothes. Fifteen years ago she obtained a piece of land and started growing rice. Since then, her labor has allowed them to build a new house, furnish it and provide it with conveniences. Hafizahon has applied for this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and clothes to sell Hafizahon’s partners Sharipahon H., 35, is married and has a daughter. She sells women’s clothes. She needs this loan to purchase new clothes. Another of Hafizahon’s partner also sells clothes. She has a daughter and her husband works as an accountant in a bus station. Her intention in obtaining this loan is to increase her turnover and purchase new clothes. Gulbarchyn S., 20, is married. She is a student at Osh State University. She works as a saleswoman in a private business. Gulbarchyn needs this loan for her own needs. The last of Hafizahon’s partners, Muminjan K., 35, is the father of two children. To provide for the family, he provides law services. Muminjan has long been planning repairs to his house. Therefore, he needs a loan to purchase cement and pebbles for construction. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for farming and some clothes to sell

loans.name: Djiguiya (Hope) Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et  au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles très variés tels, la restauration et la vente du bois de chauffe, de céréales, de légumes, de plastiques etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Fatoumata  Mallé est un membre du groupe qui vend des légumes : carottes chou, betteraves, radis, haricots vert, concombres, salades, tomates etc.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des légumes de toutes sortes au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend. Elle se procure  en légumes dans les différents coins de brousse avec les jardiniers et au marché de Koutiala. 
Pour ses activités elle a une place au cœur du marché Hamdallaye. Elle vend ses légumes en détail et au comptant  à une clientèle  constituée principalement  de femmes. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 130 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Fatoumata Mallé compte réaliser 150 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcée ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in traditional big families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 43 years old with 4 children or more. This group of women trades in varied ways such as, a restaurant, and the sale of heating wood , cereals, vegetables, plastics etc To increase the scope of their activities, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. They are on their tenth group loan and all the preceding loans were properly repaid. Fatoumata Mallé is a member of the group which sells vegetables: carrots cabbage, beets, radish, French beans, cucumbers, legumes, tomatos etc. She intends to use the loan to buy vegetables of all the kinds she sells. She gets vegetables from the surrounding countryside gardeners and at the market of Koutiala. For her activities she has a place in the middle of the Hamdallaye market. She sells vegetables retail for cash to customers made up mainly of women. While the members of the group intend to procure an average loan of 130.000FCFA each during this cycle, Fatoumata Mallé intends to borrow 150.000FCFA. In addition to repaying the loans, they use part of the income to meet current family expenses. She wishes to see this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso strengthened, to be able to diversify her products.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Tiessiri (Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les jus de fruits et légumes, les habits et chaussures etc. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Fanta S. est un membre du groupe Tièssiri qui vend des boissons fraîches (jus de fruits, boissons locales à base de jujube, de dah, de tamarin, de citron etc.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, à la veille du mois de carême, une importante quantité d’ingrédients : dah rouge, tamarin, jujube, citron  beaucoup d’arômes etc. 
Elle se procure  dans le grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend  ses boissons à la maison, dans les  quartiers, au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée. Tandis que Les membres du groupe Tièssiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Fanta S. compte réaliser 120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Tièssiri is a group of women of Koutiala who know each other well and they live in traditional big families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 33 years old with at least 3 children. This group of women trade in various articles such as fruit juices and vegetables, clothing and shoes etc. To increase the scope of their activities, the members decided to join the credit program Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago. They are on their third group loan and all the preceding loans were properly repaid. Fanta S. is a member of the Tièssiri group which sells cold drinks (fruit juice, local drinks containing jujube, roselle, tamarind, lemon etc) She intends to use her loan to buy, the day before the month of Lent, a large quantity of ingredients: roselle , tamarind, jujube, lemon, many flavours etc she gets in the large market of Koutiala. She sells her drinks from the house, and in the neighborhoods, for cash to various and varied customers. While the members of the Tièssiri group intend to borrow an average of 90.000FCFA each during this cycle, Fanta S. intends to borrow 120.000FCFA. In addition to the refunding of the loans, they use part of the income to meet the current expenses of the family. They wish to see this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso grow so that stocks are not scarce.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase ingredients for juices

loans.name: Yrysbu's Group

texts.en: The economic situation and total unemployment has pushed many people to seek employment in the Russian Federation but, however promising employment opportunities in other countries might be, this journey in search of a job is an extremely risky undertaking and requires one to be very brave and careful. Yrysbu U. is the leader of this group. She has raised four children. Her eldest daughter is 35. When she realized that her own country had little to offer in her youth, she decided to try her chances in Russia. Now she is working in Russia as a saleswoman. Yrysbu’s middle son, who is 30, also made up his mind to work in Russia. He is working in a clothing factory. Her second son, 27, works as a security guard in the biggest Kyrgyzstan market. Her younger daughter got married and now she is a housewife. As for Yrysbu’s husband, he is an actor. He works in the Naryn theater. Yrysbu raises cattle. Her son and daughter help her look after the cattle, so this activity does not present significant difficulties for Yrysbu. Eight years ago, Yrysbu bought a cow and since then has been striving to increase her cattle population. Yrysbu needs a loan to purchase sheep. She plans to save her earnings to help her grandchildren in the future. Her dream is to buy each grandchild a flat and a car. Yrysbu’s partners: Gulnara A., 45, is the mother of three sons. Gulnara combines two jobs. Apart from a regular job, she also breeds cattle. Gulnara hopes to obtain this loan and buy three sheep. Jidekul T., 62, is retired. She keeps cows and sells milk. Jidekul needs this loan to buy one more cow to increase her income. Jypargul O., 33, has a son. She works in a small factory producing sausages. Jypargul hopes to obtain this loan to buy a calf, feed it and sell it. She will use the money earned to prepare her children for school. Aimkan A., 37, has two children. She works as an accountant and also raises cattle. Aimkan sells milk and thus has an extra source of income. Aimkan has applied for this loan to buy a calf for feeding. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for breeding

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.ru:
Очень многие люди задаются вопросом о том, чем же им заниматься, чтобы прокормить себя и свою семью. Этот вопрос сейчас актуален для многих так как проблемы с трудоустройством заставили многих людей забыть о том, по какой специальности они заканчивали ВУЗ или кем они вообще были по призванию. Вот и сейчас многие люди вынуждены идти торговать на рынок. Кыргызстан в условиях современного капитализма оказался в водовороте, который повлёк за собой массовое закрытие и банкротство заводов фабрик, предприятий, что в свою очередь привело к тому, что десятки тысяч бывших инженеров и рабочих оказались в не удел. Однако жизнь продолжается и сильные духом люди даже в нынешних условиях умудряются найти для себя занятие. Айгуль Сариева – лидер данной группы. Она к своим тридцати шести годам имеет большой жизненный опыт по обеспечению себя заработком. У Айгуль одна дочь. Муж работает сварщиком. Чтобы помочь мужу прокормить семью Айгуль четыре года назад решила заняться торговлей хлопушек. Постепенно её заработок позволил ей перейти к торговле вещами. Сейчас ежемесячный заработок Айгуль составляет около одиннадцати тысяч сомов. Она уже успела купить автомобиль и тем самым сделала большой подарок своему мужу. Сейчас Айгуль надеется получить данный кредит и закупить товар. Полученную прибыль Айгуль собирается копить, чтобы в будущем оплачивать университетское образование дочери. 
Партнёры Айгуль по группе:
Адылу Сариеву сорок семь лет. Он – отец двух дочерей. Жена Адыла занимается торговлей в маленьком магазине. На данный момент Адыл работает в собственной станции техобслуживания. Адыл обратился за этим кредитом, чтобы закупить товар.  
Бермет Тынысбековой тридцать четыре года. Бермет воспитывает двоих детей и в это же время работает на р. Дордой – на одном из самых больших рынках в Центральной Азии. Она разносит чай, кофе и булочки среди продавцов. Бермет надеется получить кредит с целью открыть своё кафе. 
Динаре Нураковой двадцать восемь лет. Чтобы прокормить семью муж Динары занимается частным извозом, работает водителем такси, а сама Динара работает в швейном цеху технологом. Динара нуждается в швейной машинке и поэтому очень надеется, что этот кредит даст ей возможность купить её. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aigul S. is the leader of the group. She is thirty-six years old, married, with one daughter. Her husband is a welder. Aigul has been manufacturing firecrackers for 4 years and gradually it has allowed her to grow her apparel sales business. Currently, she makes 1,000 Soms per month. Aigul bought a car as a present for her husband. She's applying for credit to purchase apparel. She hopes to use savings to pay for her daughter's education.

Aigul has 3 partners. Adyl S. is forty-seven years old, married with 2 daughters. His wife works in a retail store. He is a mechanic and applying for a loan to purchase merchandise for his service station.

Bermet T. is a thirty-four year old mother of two. She delivers tea, coffee and pastries to merchants at one of the largest flea markets in Central Asia, on the Dordoi River. She is applying for credit to open her own cafe.

Dinara N. is twenty-eight years old and married. Her husband is a self-employed taxi driver. Dinara is a seamstress and hopes to buy a sewing machine with a loan. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase goods to resell them

loans.name: Aishahon's Group

texts.en: Third world countries share many specific characteristics. For instance, a high rate of unemployment makes people find and create jobs for themselves. Thus, there emerges a certain class of people who are not affected by the economic conditions in their country as they have their own households and can survive with their own cattle and land. The people in our story are such people, who have preferred to create their own happiness without the government’s assistance. They would rather be independent entrepreneurs than always follow the changes in economic conditions and feel unsafe. Aishahon I. is the leader of this group. She is 55 and has two children. Both of her sons are private builders. As for her husband, he and Aishahon are farmers and raise cattle. Sixteen years ago, they obtained land from the government and started farming. They started growing wheat and cotton. With great effort and tireless work, they have been able to achieve a decent income. They have been able to repair their house and marry off their son. At the moment, Aishahon needs a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for cotton. She hopes to have a good harvest and, after selling the crops, to buy new furniture for her home. Aishahon’s partners: Ilgorbek A., 27, is married and has a son. He and his father own a pasture where they raise cattle. With their income, Ilgorbek has managed to obtain a college education, find a job and get married. Now Ilgorbek needs a loan to buy a washing machine as a present for his wife. Yokutoi I., 27, is married and has two children. She used to manufacture clothes and sell them in the market. Later her husband organized a small shop within the house and now she sells foodstuffs. Yokutoi needs a loan to purchase foodstuffs to increase her turnover. Hursanai A., 33, is the mother of two children. Her husband is a cattle breeder. As for Hursanai, she looks after cattle and sells milk. With the cattle breeding, Hursanai’s family has built a new house. Hursanai needs a loan to purchase a cow. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for growing cotton

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 39 year old man from Lebanon. He is married and has two children. Walid has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2004. He sells all type of fruits and vegetables depending on the season. His products are all bio. Today, for the first time, he has requested a loan from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua. 

With his loan, he plans to cultivate his land with apples and pomegranate. This is the first time he has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He notes that when he first started his business, he passed through some financiA. issues. He hopes to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To cultivate his land with apples and pomegranate

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 23 year old borrower from Lebanon. Ayman is a dedicated construction worker. In order to improve his business, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy tools for his business. He hopes that with his loan, he will be able to support his family and work on bigger projects.

When he first started his business, he had some financial issues buying the necessary tools for his work. But thanks to his previous loan, he was able to supplement his tools and improve his work. This is his second loan from Al Majmoua. He hopes for the future, to keep on improving himself and growing in this field of industry.

loans.use: To buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
Sadek is a 24 year old married man from Lebanon. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2003. He is skilled in many kinds of metal work. Sadek is proud of his experience and good reputation in his work. He notes that it has been a challenge to secure financing for his business. 

Today, for the first time, Sadek has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua to purchase a spot welder and a machine for metal cutting for his business. He hopes that his loan will allow him to improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase a spot welder and a machine for metal cutting for his business.

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en: Kyrgyzstan is undergoing extensive political and economic changes and the latest developments in the country have led to great economic crisis. In this situation, many international agencies are providing help to relieve the effects of these events, but still there is a large number of refugees and homeless people. The Government is incapable of providing all the necessary support and financial help. In this situation any help would be significant, especially for people who have lost their shops and now are facing the cruel reality of starting everything all over again. Aizada O. is thirty-seven and is married with two children. Her son and daughter are eighteen and fifteen years old respectively and both of them are unemployed. Aizada and her husband are engaged in farming, growing vegetables to sell in the local market. Three years ago they bought a cow and started breeding cattle and, since then, their main source of income has come from selling their cattle as there appears to be a need for that. Aizada has applied for this loan to purchase more cattle to increase the total population. She would like to have more cattle and, for this reason, she is planning to double her efforts. Aizada’s partners are: Rozakan T., 44, is currently building a new shop. She used to trade in a small shop but now she wants to make it bigger to attract more customers. Rozakan hopes to obtain this loan and expand the assortment of her goods. Kuluipa A., 49, has two children. She and her husband are engaged in selling cattle. They used to raise and sell cattle, but then they just started buying cattle and reselling them as it also brought a good income. Now Kuluipa needs a loan to purchase some more cattle. Toktobu S., 23 is single and works as a PC operator. She lives in a village and wants to obtain a good college education so that she will be able to go to the capital and find better employment. She hopes to obtain this loan and apply for college to get a degree in economics. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Ailarhon's Group

texts.ru:
Нынешние условия жизни диктуют новые условия, чтобы выжить и людям постоянно приходится подстраиваться под обстоятельства, чтобы вовремя прочувствовать, куда дует ветер. И сейчас люди в Кыргызстане трепетно ищут свою нишу, где человек наконец смог бы обрести сравнительный покой и заняться любимым делом и при этом вести достойную жизнь. Айлархон Борубаева – лидер данной группы. Айлархон сорок пять лет. Вот уже который день она встаёт спозаранку, накидывает на себя платок идёт в сарай, для дойки коров. При этом её обычная работа – преподавание английского языка в местной школе. Но пятнадцать лет назад она, вместе с мужем закупили живность и начали заниматься животноводством, а именно разведением крупнорогатого скота и реализацией молока. На сегодняшний день у Айлархон имеется три дойные коровы и три тёлки. Это занятие приносит ей пять тысяч сомов, что само по себе является довольно хорошей заработной платой в сельской местности. У Айлархон четверо детей. Старшая дочь учится в университете, а средняя недавно вышла замуж. Младшая дочь находится дома и помогает Айлархон по хозяйству, а саамы младший сын работает на стройке. Айлархон обратилась за этим кредитом, так как планирует купить одну тёлку на откорм. В ближайшем будущем ей надо накопить достаточно средств на ремонт дома, и надо также выдать двух дочерей замуж и закупить мебель. Айлархон понимает, что надо работать и продолжать трудиться. 
Партнёры Айлархон по группе:
Гайратбеку Пиратову тридцать пять лет. Гайратбек уже десять лет занимается откормом и перепродажей быков. Он три месяца откармливает бычков, а затем реализует их на скотном рынке. У Гайратбека растут трое детей и поэтому ему надо увеличивать доход, чтобы покрывать растущие расходы семьи. Гайратбеку нужен кредит, чтобы купить тёлку для разведения. 
Тилляхан Сарматовой сорок три года. Она – мать троих детей. Для Тилляхан самое главное это вырастить детей и помочь встать им на ноги. На данный момент она занимается животноводчтвом и выращиванием кукурузы. Она уже на пенсии. Получив этот кредит она хочет купить тёлку.
Суюмкуль Юсуповой сорок семь лет. Суюмкуль занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. У Суюмкуль четверо детей. Старшие дети уже работают, младшему сыну всего пять лет. Суюмкуль понимает, что любое дело требует постоянных инвестиций и вложений. Она хочет получить кредит и купить корову с телёнком. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Life is ever-changing and people have to be constantly aware of their present circumstances to be prepared for when the winds change. Now, people in Kirgizstan are in an avid search for a haven, where they could lead a quality life while working their dream job. Ailarhon B. is the leader of this group. She’s forty-five years old and she begins her day at sunrise milking the cows. It is worthy to note, that her day job is teaching English at a local school. But fifteen years ago, together with her husband, she bought some livestock and began to breed cattle -- raising and milking it. Today her flock includes three heifers and three milking cows. This business brings in about five thousand soms a month, which is a very decent income in the countryside. Ailarahon has four children. Her oldest daughter is studying at a university, her middle one just got married, and her youngest daughter helps her mother around the house and with the business. Her youngest child – her son – works construction. Ailrahon is asking for a loan, because she plans to expand her business and buy another cow. In the near future she needs enough resources to fix up her house, buy new furniture and marry off her daughters. She understands that this will involve dedication and constant work. She has three partners in the group: Gairatbek P. is thirty-five years old, and the last ten of them he has fattened and sold livestock. He buys a bull, fattens it for about three months, and then resells it at the livestock market. He has three growing children, and so he needs to increase his income if he wants to meet the growing needs of his family. With the loan, he would buy a heifer to raise more cattle. Tillyahan S. is forty-three years old and a mother of three children. Her main objective in life is to raise her children and help them get a good start in life. She’s retired right now and raises livestock and corn for a living. She’s asking for a loan to buy another cow. Suyumkul U. is forty-seven years old. She also fattens and sells cattle for profit. She has four children, the oldest of which are already working, and the youngest is five years old. Suyumkul understands that any business requires investment and dedication. She’s requesting a loan to buy a cow and a calf.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a calf for breeding

loans.name: Mirumar

texts.en:
A. Mirumar is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and has three children. Just like his family, he has been a farmer since he was a young.  His parents grew a large amount of crops. Mirumar is happy being a farmer. He likes it very much and following the example of his brother, he plants and then later he or his wife takes the products to market to sell.  In this way he does not have to give away any of his efforts to middlemen. Farming gives Mirumar a good earning. He tells us that you only need to know how to take care of what you plant and to pay attention to what the crops need. As such, he fertilizes so that he will have a good harvest. 

This is his first loan with IMON International and he will be responsible with his payments. With the money he is requesting , he will buy high-quality seeds and fertilizer. Mirumar is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his goals with this loan.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.en:
K. Muhammadjon is the father of three children, for whom he has to take care of and provides daily sustenance. He has dedicated himself to the agriculture industry since he was very young and has acquired experience. In this way, he is able to maintain his family. 

Today this gentleman needs to acquire a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for planting wheat, watermelon and onion. For this reason Muhammadjon has come to IMON International to obtain the  necessary loan so that he can continue caring for his humble family that needs his support.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Galib

texts.ru:
Galib Azizovu 47 let. On jivet v Baku qorode. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey dochek odna iz kotoroy 17 let i ona v etom qodu postupayet v universitet a druqaya yey 15 let i ona idet na muziku zanimayetsya skripkoy. On v etom biznese uje 7 let. 

Teper Galib nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya mashini . Posledniy raz on povez kliyenta v derevnu i tam doroqi bili ploximi posle etoqo mashina u neqo isportilas. teper on xotel bi za schet etoqo kredita ispravit mashinu i s udobstvom vozit ludiy v nujniye punkti.
texts.en:
Galib A. is 47 years old. He lives in Baku. He is married and has two children. One daughter is seventeen years old and is entering the university this year. The other is fifteen and she studies the violin. He has been doing this business for seven years. Galib now needs 2000 AZN to pay for necessary repairs for his car. The last time he took a client to the countryside the roads were bad, and after that his car was ruined. Now, he would like to take out a loan to fix his car so he can comfortably transport people to where they need to go.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
N. Komil is married and the father of three children. He is a farmer and since his marriage he has demonstrated that he can support his family with hard work and dedication. Because of this, he is always in the fields, growing wheat and vegetables. Komil leaves early in the morning to water the fields, then fertilizes and fumigates the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables him to purchase goods for his home. 

Komil would like to request a loan of 8500 Somoni which he will use to buy necessary farm materials like seeds and fertilizers since they are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this loan will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Komil always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the traditional bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Irade

texts.ru:
Irade Radilas v 1964 qodu. Ona jenata i jivet v qorode Baku. U neyo yest 2 rebonka kotorim 10 i 14 let. Malchik 14 let uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom a dochka 10 let zanimayetysa nacionalnimi tancami. Irade uje 10 let v etom biznese. Eyo babushka toje bila vrachom  i ona s detstva uchila yeyo kak lechit ludey i potom Irade postupila v universitet medicinskiy i nachala rabotat.

Irada nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye aparati dlya raboti. S kajdimk dnem aparatura usovershenstvuyetsya a u neyo staraya aparatura vot pochemu ona xochet kredit chtobi kupit vse novoye chtob kliyenti ostovalis dovolnimi.
texts.en:
Irade was born in 1964. She is married and lives in Baku. She has two children who are ten and fourteen years old. The fourteen-year-old boy goes to school and plays sports. The ten year old girl studies traditional dances. Irade has been in business for ten years. Her grandmother was also a doctor, and, as a child, Irade learned how to treat people from her. Later, Irade entered the medical university and began working. Irade needs 2000 AZN to buy new equipment for work. Every day, medical equipment gets better and better, but she has old equipment. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan to buy new equipment in order to keep her clients satisfied.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medical equipment

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru:
Nazar D. jivet v qorode Baku. On nedavno obruchilsya . Emu 26 let. On jivet so svoyey materyu i smotrit za ney. Ve tom biznese on uje 5 let. Etot maqazin bil maqazinom eqo otca. S detstva on pomoqal pape a seychas etot maqazin stal eqo maqazinom.

Nazar teper nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit noviy tavari dlya mitya posud i odejdi, takje iz za toqo chto u nas mnoqo pokupayut ris takje xotel on kupit ris. Kaka vi videte v eqo maqazine malo produkta on xotelbi za schet kredi ta uvelichit doxodnost i kliyentov v maqazine.
texts.en:
Nazar D. lives in Baku. He is recently engaged. He is 26 years old. He lives with his mother and takes care of her. He has been doing this business for five years. His store belonged to his father. Since childhood, he helped his father there, and now the store is his. Nazar now needs 2000 AZN to buy new goods such as dish washing supplies and clothes. Additionally, since many people locally buy rice he would like to buy rice as well. As you can see, his store has too few products and he wants to take out a loan to increase his income and the number of customers in his store.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy new products

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
A. Firuza is an enterprising business owner. She has a place at a market where she sells kid’s clothing. Her business is doing well and provides a large part of her family’s income. Firuza is married and has three children. She has requested a loan of 6000 Somoni to help purchase a new supply of inventory. Today is a good day to help someone in need. Don’t hesitate, your support will be a big help to this woman. Thanks!  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing supplies of new children's clothing for the summer season.

loans.name: Asalgul

texts.en:
D. Asalgul is married woman and the loving mother of 4 children. She is an active entrepreneur selling clothing for kids. She has a circle of loyal clients and a variety of merchandise in her shop. Asalgul has gained rich experience working in this sphere of trade over the last 10 years. All of her business endeavors have been characterized by commitment and reliability. She tries to please each of her customers’ tastes. She is always seeking to expand the assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her shop. Asalgul started this business on her own, but now her children are actively helping her run this family venture. 

Today Asalgul is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to re-stock her inventory and continue expanding her trade.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase supplies of clothing for expanding her business.

loans.name: Sangmahmad

texts.en:
M. Sangmahmad has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from a young age that his family never goes without daily bread. He is married with two children. Sangmahmad has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff. With a starting capital of $400 USD, and perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 5 years ago. He has expanded his business and today his family helps him with the business. Today he needs to buy additional foodstuff to increase the variety of his products. For this purpose, Sangmahmad is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of foodstuff for increase the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Yoshmatkhodja

texts.en:
P. Yoshmatkhodja is 52 years old. He is married with 6 children. Yoshmatkhodja sells foodstuff like macaroni, wheat, buckwheat, cottonseed oil, tea and many other products. The business is private. When Yoshmatkhodja started the business 15 years ago it was only retail sales. Gradually expanding the business he purchased larger supplies of goods and as a wholesaler, distributed it among the stores. The business became successful and stable. Currently Yoshmatkhodja requests a loan of 13000 Somoni. The loan will be spent purchasing foodstuff to increase the variety of goods sold. Yoshmatkhodja thanks all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase supplies of foodstuff in order to increase the variety of goods sold.

loans.name: Gafur

texts.en:
S. Gafur grows different kinds of vegetables and raises cattle. He is 55 years old and has 5 children. Before this, he worked as a driver. Gafur was not happy with his previous job because he received little compensation for his work. So he went back to his village and decided to manage his small farm. In the year 1997 Gafur started managing his farming and cattle raising business. He uses his harvest to buy the things his family needs and to help send his children to school. Gafur is asking for a loan of $2000 USD. He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and cattle. The loan will help him increase his yield and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase seed, mineral fertilizer and cattle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 32 year-old woman who runs a general store in a busy market area selling a variety of goods, including sugar, flour, soda, utensils, and even some clothing.  She has been in this business for 3 years and her primary business challenge is bad debts from creditors that don’t pay. Before running her store, she sold tomatoes.  Nancy has two children, a daughter 6 years old and a son almost 2 years old.

Nancy plans to use the 70,000 Kenya Shilling loan to increase the stock in her store (utensils, sugar, flour, etc.).

In the future, she hopes to expand from retail into wholesale.  In 5 years, she would like to see her children through school and to increase her income by significantly expanding her business.

Nancy describes herself as honest, determined, and hardworking.

loans.use: To increase the stock of the store (utensils, sugar, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah T. is married to Asaah Henry and they have brought forth eight children. As a woman who does not like to depend on her husband for all the family needs she decided to join GHAPE in 2009. Tawah has been having a lot of marital problems with her family. Moreover. her husband is an asthmatic patient which makes it difficult at times for him to support the family. She recently lost her son who had been quite  helpful to her. Thieves stole her business articles which cause a lot of problem to her. This has made her sad but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire to educate her children keeps her working hard. She states that she feels better each time she provides something, no matter how small, for her children. Her inability to acquire investment capital, which could generate income for her to meet her family needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE.
.
Given a loan, she plans to buy groundnut, cocoyam, beans, cassava, plantain and corn from far off villages to resell at retail in the city. She knows this business will successful because she is located at a good business site and she has a good knowledge of the business. She plans to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to have a bigger house to accommodate the family. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase groundnut, cocoyam, cassava, plantains, corn and beans

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a single mother of two children and her two children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Catherine resides in and owns a three roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food, school fees and treatment.She owns a stall in Naguru selling vegetables like tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She buys these vegetables from Nakawa Market and uses public transport to and from shopping and goes for shopping on a daily basis.  

Catherine wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions and banana leaves. Besides this business she also sells piped water at her home. During morning hours she sells in the market and during lunch time she goes to her home and again sells from there. She sells to all types of people both in retail and wholesale.  She works seven days a week.  Her business challenge is the change of seasons.  Catherine aspires to see her business grow, earn enough profits to educate her children up to university and also start going to farmers directly .  She joined MCDT because they were caring and very cooperative.

loans.use: To buy more  boxes of  tomatoes, onions and banana leaves

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is a single mother of six children, none of whom go to school. She does not take care of additional family members. Merina owns a retail shop in Kisaasi selling merchandise such as sugar, maize flour, washing and bathing soap, cooking oil, salt and bread. She works from her home and therefore doesn’t pay rent for her business premises. She has been in this business for ten years and she works seven days a week. Her customers are local people. Merina resides in and owns a four room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and utilities.

Merina wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, bags of maize flour, jerrycans of cooking oil and cartons of baking flour. She shops once a week, using public transportation. Her business challenges are thieves and transportation of merchandise from Kampala to her shop in the Kisaasi Kulambiro zone. She hopes to see her business grow big and to own a fully stocked wholesale shop. She joined MCDT to boost her business by acquiring additional capital.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking oil and baking flour

loans.name: Positivas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en el decimo segundo ciclo.
 Entre las integrantes se encuentra la Sra. Jacinta P. 42 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos se dedica en la venta de grasa en las panaderías de la zona.
Ella  se encarga de comprar y elaborar las grasas en su casa de acuerdo a la cantidad que solicita cada panadería. 
Es una señora muy sacrificada ya la actividad de compra y elaboración lo realiza ella sola, por ejemplo ir a comprar del supermercado que se encuentra a unos kilómetros de su casa adelante.   
 Además ella cuenta con una despensita donde invierte sus ganancias.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de gran cantidad de materia prima para elaborar la grasa.
texts.en:
The Positivas Group is in its 12th loan cycle. Among the members is Jacinta, who is 42 years old and has 4 children. She sells cooking fat to the bakeries of her region. Jacinta is a very sacrificing woman who does all her own buying and selling activity. She buys her supplies from a supermarket some kilometers from her house. Jacinta can count on a small larder where she invests her earnings. Jacinta is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of primary ingredients to make cooking fat.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRIME MATERIALS TO MAKE COOKING FAT FOR LOCAL BAKERIES

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna S. est une femme de 30 ans elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de KANDIA1 depuis le 1er juin 2007 et a 6 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de carburant et de lubrifiant, elle habite un ville éloigné de la ville, les population se déplacent très souvent en moto alors que ces produits se font rares du fait de la distance. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en carburant et lubrifiant et revendre aux populations locales. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maimouna S. is a 30-year old woman who is a widow and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KANDIA1 since June 1st, 2007 and has received six consecutive loans, all repaid without incident. She is starting a small business selling fuel and lubricant. She lives in a village away from the city and people often move around on motorcycles, but these products are scarce due to the distance. Her new loan will allow her to stock up on fuel and lubricant, and sell to local people. In doing so, she plays an active role in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run a small business selling fuel and lubricant

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica a la producción de tostado de maíz, fideo y arroz, lo cual lo produce artesanalmente, que este arte aprendio de sus abuelos, la Señora antes vivía en alquiler, pero trabajando fuerte logro comprarse una casa que ahora es de ladrillo y adobe, ella vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Que cada mañana se levantan a trabajar y producir tostado y así poder repartir a sus clientas. Actualmente su casa se encuentra a unos 2 kilómetros de la carretera a Quillacollo Cochabamba, a la Sra. Julia le es muy  difícil salir hasta la avenida, pero su esposo tiene un pequeño auto que le ayuda a trasladar su tostado. La señora se siente muy feliz por darle la oportunidad de acceder al crédito con fondos kiva, ya que le permite aumentar de capital y mantener a sus 4 hijos. En la foto se le ve muy contenta ya que se le encontró con las manos en el tostado.
texts.en:
Julia makes toasted corn, beans, and rice, which she produces artisan fashion, an art she learned from her grandparents. She used to live in a rental unit but by working hard, Julia was able to buy a house which, now, is of bricks and adobe. She lives with her husband and 4 children. Each morning Julia rises and goes to work, producing toasted goods to supply her customers. At present, her house is some 2 kilometers from the Quillacollo-Cochabamba highway. It is very difficult for Julia to get her products to the avenue, but her husband has a small car and he helps her transport her toasted goods. She feels very happy to have access to loans with Kiva credit, because it permits her to expand her capital and maintain her 4 children. In the photo, you will see her very content, displaying her toasted products.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RICE, SUGAR, AND BEANS TO MAKE TOASTED ARTISAN PRODUCTS

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Rodríguez C., está casado y es padre de una hija a la cual educa y apoya en su educación.

Carlos Rodríguez C. es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, el trabaja como moto taxista en el sindicado “10 de Noviembre” en el trópico de Cochabamba ya como 2 años, el trabaja día a día para que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones, él es una persona muy responsable, el cuenta con su motocicleta para mantener a su familia ya que es la única fuente de ingreso con la que el cuenta. 

El señor Carlos se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta para así poder trabajar con su propia motocicleta y no simplemente como chofer y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y poder brindarles un futuro mejor a ellos.
texts.en:
Carlos Rodríguez C. is married and the father of a daughter he is educating. Carlos Rodríguez C. is a young man who is very dedicated to his work. He has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver with a group called "10 de Noviembre" in the tropic of Cochabamba for two years. He works day after day so his family can have better living conditions. He is a very responsible person who counts on his motorcycle to support his family since it is the only source of income he has. Mr. Carlos came in person to our office searching for a loan to buy a motorcycle so he can have his own motorcycle for work and not just be a driver. This will be a way to earn more money for the good of his family and to provide them with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to work as a Taxi driver.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
El Señor Demetrio H. A., es soltero no tiene hijos él se vino al trópico de Cochabamba para buscar trabajo y tener una vida mejor. 

Demetrio H. A. es un joven dedicado a su trabajo, el trabaja como chofer de taxi en el sindicato de transporte “PORTEÑO” haciendo un recorrido de Ivirgarzama – Pto. Villarroel, el no cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres ya que ellos fallecieron recientemente, sus hermanos ya están casados por lo cual él se independizo a muy temprana edad y en su tiempo libre trabajo como albañil en diferentes ciudades. 

El señor Demetrio H. A. se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de un lote agrícola para así poder plantar de cítricos y empezar una nueva vida. Su mayor sueño es poder tener una vasta plantación de cítricos y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Demetrio H. A. is single and has no children. He came to the Cochabamba tropics to look for work and to have a better life. Demetrio H. A. is a young man who is dedicated to his work. He works as a taxi drive for the “PORTEÑO” taxi syndicate. He works the route from Ivirgarzama – Pto. Villarroel. He does not have his parents’ support because they recently died. His siblings are married, so he became independent at a very young age. In his time off he works as a bricklayer in different cities. Demetrio H. A. came to our offices looking for a loan for a down payment on a plot of farm land. This way he will be able to plant citrus and start a new life. His biggest dream is to be able to have a vast citrus field to be able to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land to plant citrus

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is married to a hotelier. They have four children, all of whom go to school. She is also taking care of additional family members. She owns a retail shop in Naguru where she sells all types of merchandise. She is proud of this business. She buys her merchandise from Nakawa market and uses public transportation to and from Nakawa. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. The customers of her retail shop include all types of people. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to grow her business and start selling wholesale only. She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital. She resides in and rents a two-room house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more products to stock her retail shop

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del 12º ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Reimunda Giménez quien es una mujer muy trabajadora. Ella tiene  29 años, tiene 4 hijos se dedica a vender pescado, tiene su puesto en el mercado y también vende en su casa.
Ella trabaja todo el día en la venta de pescado que le genera el ingreso para ayudar a su marido quien no tiene trabajo fijo, y de esta manera mantienen a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado para seguir trabajando en esta actividad.
texts.en:
This group is currently working on their 12th loan cycle. One of the members is Reimunda Giménez, who is a very hardworking woman. She is 29 years old and has 4 children. She sells fish from a stall in the market, and she also sells from her home. She works all day selling fish, and this generates an income that helps her husband to support the family, since he does not have a regular job. She requests this loan to buy fish so that she can continue to work in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Victo

texts.en: Victo is a single mother of school-aged children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Nakawa market, one of the busiest markets in Nakawa division, selling second-hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for fours years. Besides this clothing business, she also sells piped water. Victo sells to all kinds of people, on both a retail and a wholesale basis. She works six days a week. Her primary business challenge is the rainy season because she works in an open place. She aspires to grow her business and to start selling wholesale only. She also hopes to build her own house. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting additional capital. Victo resides in and rents a two-room house; the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food, school fees, and rent.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Poderoso De Israel 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en: Verenice (the one with the green shirt) is the coordinator of her group "Poderoso D. Israel". This is a biblical name which refers to J. Christ ("The Powerful One of Israel"). Verenice is excited to be taking her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling food. She makes her home in a simple structure with her only child, being a young single mom. She has a little cafeteria, where she cooks lunches and dinners. She will buy rice, beans, meat, oil, eggs, salad and other supplies. She says that her most difficult challenge is getting good medical assistance when they need it. She doesn't like the public services because they are inefficient and there are so many in need most of the time. Verenice is planning to have a medical check-up as soon as possible. She will use the profit from her business to buy some household items. Her future with Esperanza means more loans to invest in her business so she can bring in more income for her family. This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in an area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, that suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, meats, oil, etc.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela trabaja como empleada de limpieza, a la vez es artesana. Teje chompas y esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso, tiene 3 hijos todos están a su cargo. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Brasil  de la ciudad del  Alto. 

El préstamo que ahora solicita a través de Kiva, lo destinará para la compra de  lana por cantidad  para su actividad el tejido de chompas.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro; el análisis socioeconómico muestra su capacidad de pago y la necesidad que tiene para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Graciela works as a cleaning employee, and at the same time she is also an artisan. She knits sweaters, and this activity is her main source of income. She has 3 children in her care. Her home is located in the Brasil area of the city of El Alto. The loan she requests now through Kiva will be used to buy wool in bulk for her activity of knitting sweaters. This is her first loan with IMPRO, and their socioeconomic analysis shows her ability to pay, and the need that she has to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wool to continue her business knitting sweaters to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 40 años, es viuda y  sola logro sacar  adelante a sus 4 hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con dos de ellos en su casa que es propia, pues los mayores ya  trabajan y son  independientes.Ya lleva 2 años trabajando en el cultivo de papa, alverja, y habas. Paralelamente  a esta actividad se dedica en las mañanas y tardes a su negocio de venta de comida (agua de manzana, maca, soya, además de pan con relleno de queso, pollo y carne de chancho), en la plaza de su ciudad, donde instala su kiosco. Y como si fuera poco, también vende diversas golosinas en el cafetín de la escuela de su zona, dice que lo mejor  es atender amablemente a los clientes, pues por el buen trato siempre regresan, además su mejor ayudante es su último  hijo, quien se encarga de entregar los pedidos y lavar los utensilios. Las actividades que desempeña son bastante rentables porque le permiten vivir cómodamente, por eso para más adelante tiene planeado instalar un negocio de venta de verduras, que estará ubicado en un puesto del mercado mayorista de la ciudad.Esla segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP,  y le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque  esta integrado por personas emprendedoras y responsables.Carmen tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de alverja, para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y generarse mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen, 40, is a widow and has managed to support her 4 children on her own. Now she lives with only two of them in her own house. The oldest children now work and are independent. For 2 years Carmen has been working to cultivate potatoes, peas and beans.
