While she works in agriculture in the mornings, in the afternoons she also has a business selling food (agua de manzana (an apple drink), maca (an Andean root vegetable), soy, and also bread filled with cheese, chicken and pork) in a plaza in her city where she has a kiosk. And if that weren't enough, she also sells a variety of snacks in a cafe in a school in her area. She says that it is best to attend to her customers graciously, because as a result of the good treatment they always return. In addition, her best assistant is her youngest son, who is in charge of delivering orders and cleaning the utensils. The activities that she performs are sufficiently profitable, because they allow her to live comfortably. For this reason in the future she has plans to set up a business selling vegetables that will be located in a stall in the wholesale market in her city. This is the second time that she has taken a loan with MFP, and she enjoys working with her communal group very much because it is made up of people who are hardworking and responsible. Carmen plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of a number of bags of organic fertilizer, that she will scatter over her cultivations of peas to improve the quality of her crops and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es comerciante de libros, tiene un puesto en la zona centra la de ciudad de La Paz, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 16 y 9 años de edad mismos que depende de ella; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (libros) para poder participar en una feria de libros que se llevará a cabo dentro de dos semanas en la ciudad de El Alto..
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del prestamos solicitado por Lucy.
texts.en:
Lucy sells books; she has a stall in the central area of the city of La Paz. She is a single mother of 2 children who are 16 and 9 years old and who are dependent on her. She has a house located in the Mariscal Sucre neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She will use this loan to buy merchandise (books) so that she can participate in a book fair that will be taking place over two weeks in the city of El Alto. This is her first loan with IMPRO, and their evaluation qualified Lucy favorably for the loan that she requested.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more books so that she can participate in the upcoming book fair in the city of El Alto

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su sexto  ciclo y es un grupo muy unido y demuestran mucha solidaridad entre sus integrantes.
 Dentro del grupo hay se mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras y una de ellas es la señora Sra. Clara Espínola quien  tiene  25 años, con un hijo se dedica a vender comestibles en sus horas libres, ella recorre por varios lugares para vender al contado o a crédito. 
Actualmente vive con sus padres  y realiza esta actividad para mantener a su hijo ya que es madre soltera, solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, maquillajes y otros. .
texts.en:
This group is currently in its 6th loan cycle. It is a very united group that has demonstrated a lot of solidarity amongst its members. Within the group there are women who work hard and struggle to get ahead. One of these is Clara Espínola, who is 25 years old and has a son. She sells groceries in her free time, traveling to various places to sell on a cash or credit basis. Currently she lives with her parents, and she carries out this activity to support her son since she is a single mother. She requests this loan to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, creams, makeup and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and makeup

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelly Elizabeth tiene 29 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Jucuapa del departamento D. Usulután, Es casada tiene dos hijos D.  3 y 1 año D. edad, su esposo es policía y ella tiene un tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad.
Inicialmente ella le ayudaba a la madre,  la cual la motivo a que emprendiera su propia tienda en la cual venD. artículos D. primera necesidad, atienD. el negocio D. lunes a domingo, lo cual a servido para solventar las necesidades básicas D. su familia.
Nelly solicita un préstamo para compra D. productos que actualmente no tiene y sus clientes demanda, por lo cual ella invertirá en la compra D.: Frijoles, arroz, aceite, azúcar, café , esto permitirá incrementar las ventas, mejorar su condiciones D. vida D. la familia.
Sus aspiraciones son mantener el negocio, incremento sus ingresos los cuales le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijos, a futuro le gustaría abrir otra tienda en el sector del municipio D. Jucuapa.
texts.en:
Nelly Elizabeth is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Jucuapa in the Usulután department. She is married and has 2 children aged 1 and 3. Her husband is a policeman and she has a store where she sells products that are basic necessities. She started out initially helping her mother, who motivated her to start her own store selling basic necessities. She attends to this business every day, and it serves to cover the basic expenses of her family. Nelly requests a loan to buy products that she currently does not have and that her customers are demanding. She will invest in the purchase of: beans, rice, cooking oil, sugar, and coffee. This will allow her to increase her sales and improve the living conditions of her family. She aspires to keep her business and increase her income, which will enable her to support her children. In the future, she would like to open another store in a neighborhood in the municipality of Jucuapa.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, cooking oil, sugar and coffee

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza 2 Group

texts.en:
Tana is the coordinator of her group, La union hace la fuerza 2, which means "union makes strength." She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge relates to her children: she operates her business so that she can make sure her children are educated.

Tana is excited to be seeking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business in doing so. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, oil, flour, vegetables, and other goods. Her business is a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make food on a daily basis. Normally, these colmados are located just a short walk from any home. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy school supplies for her children.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugar cane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., rice, beans, oil, flour, and vegetables)

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa, de 49 años, es una mujer luchadora, que enviudó hace 18 años, ella vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 3 hijos, quienes son la razón de su vida.Su vida es significado de esfuerzo constante, más aún cuando el motor que la impulsa son sus hijos, por esta razón lleva 15 años dedicada  al cultivo de alverja, papa y gladiolos. También se dedica al negocio de venta de diferentes tipos de verduras, que compra en las chacras, las cosecha y las traslada al mercado mayorista de su ciudad, y también a  la selva  donde las comercializa a los mayoristas, a buenos precios. Obtiene buenas ganancias económicas de sus ventas que son seguras, gracias al  apoyo de su hijo mayor, y lo que más le gusta de su labor es observar como crecen sus sembríos, que serán presagio de buenas cosechas. Para más adelante tiene planeado incrementar su productividad de verduras, arrendando terrenos, pues todas sus chacras propias están produciendo muy bien para su satisfacción.Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está feliz de continuar laborando junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, a quienes aprecia mucho, pues comparten todas sus experiencias durante las reuniones mensuales.Felipa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de semilla de papa de buena calidad, además de varios sacos de abono, que le permitirán  mejorar la calidad de su producción.
texts.en:
Felipa, 49, is a strong woman who has been widowed for 18 years. She lives in a rented house with her three children, who are the meaning of her life. Her life is marked by constant effort, even more so when the force that drives her are her children. For this reason, she has worked for 15 years farming peas, potatoes and gladiolas. She also sells different types of vegetables that she buys from farms, collects them and brings them to her city’s wholesale market as well as to the rain forest where she sells to wholesalers at good prices. Felipa earns good income from her sales which are steady thanks to the help of her eldest son. What she likes most about her work is watching how her crops grow, portending good harvests. For the future she has planned to increase vegetable production by leasing land since all of her own crops have been producing satisfactorily. This is the second time that Felipa has a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to continue working together with the members of her community bank, whom she greatly appreciates. They share all of their business experiences during their monthly meetings. Felipa has planned to invest the requested funds in the purchase of various sacks of quality potato seed, and several sacks of fertilizer which will enable her to improve production quality.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer for Crops

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del tercer ciclo del programa de comités de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Entre la mujeres de este comité se encuentra la señora Juana A., quien tiene 50  años de edad,  con 2 hijos, quienes se quedan  en la casa mientras ella sale a ofrecer Quiniela (juegos de azar) ya que se dedica a la venta ambulante de juegos de azar, esta actividad lo realiza por la mañana y tarde solo regresa a sus para  preparar  el almuerzo.
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar a su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para compra de ropas para sus hijos y para otros gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
The committee above is working within its third cycle of Fundación Paraguaya’s women’s program. Among the women of this group is Juana, 50, with two children who stay at home while she sells lottery games. She work in the morning and returns later to prepare lunch for her children. Juana is an enduring woman with a very intense schedule. In addition to her work, she must complete housework and everything else does in order to get ahead with her children as a single mom. This is how she has been able to keep expenses related to her home and to her two children who are in school. She requests this loan to buy clothes for her children and for other family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Clothing and Family Expenses

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Petty trading, like the sale of groceries, is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start. It usually begins with tabletop selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes a supermarket. Janet is one such entrepreneur. She has been selling groceries like washing powder, bottled water, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc., for the past two years. Janet is 39 years old and married to a commercial driver. They have three children between the ages of 1 and 11 years. She is hoping that she will be able to expand her business and make more money to support the education of her children. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit and also expanding her market to include the sale of used clothes.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 40 años, es una mujer ejemplar, vive con su pareja Andrés (50)  y sus 4 hijos, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace  10 años se dedica  al cultivo de alverja, habas, papas, flores de gladiolo y varias verduras (como espinaca, lechuga y culantro). Su esposo trabaja en la panadería de su hermana, por horas, por lo que ella  solo trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos. Lo  que más le gusta es retirar la mala hierba de sus cultivos para darles el espacio suficiente para que logren desarrollarse libremente, sin embargo, le disgusta el fuerte monto que paga por trasladar su cosecha. Ella, refiere que a pesar que la agricultura en algunas cosechas no es buena, siempre deja ganancias, por eso quiere incrementar su productividad, de igual modo, desea instalar su propia panadería pues sus hijos mayores conocen los procesos de elaboración del pan.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, porque son personas responsables, a quienes ella, exige puntualidad, al ser parte de la junta directiva del grupo.Gloria tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de  dos bolsas de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de abono, ya que desea mejorar la  productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 40, is an exemplary woman. She lives with her life partner, 50 year old Andrés, and their four children. She lives in her own house. She has been growing peas, beans, potatoes, gladiola flowers, and various greens (like spinach, lettuce, and coriander) for ten years. Her husband works part-time in his sister’s bakery. That is why she only has help working from her children. What she likes the best is removing the weeds from her crops. She does this to give them enough space to develop freely. However, she does not like the hefty amount she pays to transport her crops. She says that in spite of some harvests not being good, they always produce income. That is why she wants to increase her productivity. She also wishes to set up her own bakery. Her older children know the process for making bread. This is her second loan with MFP. She likes working with the members of her communal bank because they are responsible people. As part of the governing board of the communal bank she requires punctuality. Gloria plans to invest the requested money by purchasing two bags of pea seeds and various sacks of fertilizer. She wishes to improve her crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds and fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Guillermo Aquilino

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 28 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa sus dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 6 años, posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad. 
El inicio el negocio hace 15 años, desde muy joven emprendió su venta con pocos productos en la actualidad lo administra  con éxito, es una persona trabajadora, y actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar productos, que le permitan incrementar las ventas, atraer clientes, el quiere invertir en la compra de: Arroz, azúcar, aceite, café, boquitas, bebidas gaseosas. 
Sus aspiraciones son sacar adelante a la familia, apoyas a sus hijos con los estudios, incrementar el negocio para mejor calidad de vida de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 28, lives in the Cinameca municipality in the San Miguel department. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages eight and six. He has a store selling basic needs products. He started his business 15 years ago. When he was very young he undertook his sales with a small amount of products. Now he manages the business successfully. He is a hard-working man. He is currently requesting a loan to buy products, which would allow him to increase his sales and attract customers. He wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, coffee, snacks, and soft drinks. His aspirations are to get his family ahead, support his children with their education, and to increase his business in order to improve his loved ones’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, coffee, snacks, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is truly a hard worker. He is a 36-year-old carpenter with special skills in manufacturing loud speakers.  He skillfully cuts pieces of plywood to make loud speakers by custom order according to the designs and preferences of his customers. He has been operating his trade for eighteen years and is eager to be taking out this loan. He plans to use this loan to purchase plywood in bulk to support his business.

Jones is married to a woman who works in a printing press. They have three children aged 7–11. He says that he dreams of being able to generate enough profits to be able to educate his children to the tertiary school level.

loans.use: To purchase plywood in bulk

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Oñondivepa” tiene antigüedad de más de 1 año de formación y trabajo con la Fundación  Paraguaya.
Cada una de las señoras realiza una actividad diferente de acuerdo a la facilidad y herramienta con que cuentan.
Para el caso de la señora Jorgelina quien tiene una cantina con venta de bebidas de todo tipo.
Ella ofrece sus productos en un salón que posee frente a su casa, donde constantemente muchos clientes especialmente en horas de la noche recurren a su negocio.
Comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha con su negocio y solicita el crédito para la compra de mas bebidas como vinos, cervezas y gaseosa de diferentes marca y procedencia para satisfacer los pedidos de los clientes.
texts.en:
The "Oñondivepa" committee has a history of over one year of training and work with Fundacion Paraguaya. Each one of the women have a different job corresponding to the opportunities and tools that they have. In Jorgelina's case, she has a bar where she sells all sorts of drinks. She offers her products in a room that she has in front of her house; where there are constantly many customers, especially in the night hours. She comments that she is very satisfied with her business and is requesting this loan for the purchase of more drinks such as wines, beers, and soft drinks of different brands to satisfy the requests of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of drinks such as wines, beers, liquors, soft drinks and others.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a persevering businesswoman who sells fresh yams to customers in the central market of Kumasi. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children aged 1 and 5. She spends most of her time taking care of her business and supporting her kids in school. 

She loves selling and enjoys serving customers. Janet believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful yam traders. She plans to invest the loan to purchase more tubers of yam to fill her demand. Janet is optimistic about the future and she hopes to purchase yams directly from farmers and become a yam wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase fresh yams in bulk

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a determined businesswoman, a hardworking and resourceful mother of three children. She is 52 years old. Sophia is a petty trader who sells palm oil to customers in her community. Operating her trade for the past 20 years, Sophia has amassed good marketing experience and made many customers. She plans to invest this loan to purchase a fresh supply of palm oil to meet her customers’ demands. She dreams of being able to sell palm oil in larger quantities to make more income to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny, de 30 años, es una mujer muy colaboradora, vive en la casa de su madre junto a su esposo Atis (33), ellos tienen 3 hijos pequeños.Se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, alverja y flor de gladiolo, es una  de las mejores de su zona, gracias a la esmerada dedicación que les brinda. Lo que más le gusta a Jenny, es sembrar flor de gladiolo y disfrutar de su exquisito olor, sin embargo, a veces le molesta  terrenos estén alejados de su casa. Además de la actividad agrícola también cría 16 vacas que tiene en lo alto del pueblo donde vive, y su esposo trabaja como perforista en una mina de una ciudad al sur del Perú y llega a su domicilio cada 20 días. Para más adelante ella  piensa en continuar sembrando, por lo que quiere comprar más terrenos productivos en su localidad, también desea construir una casa en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, para instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está contenta de laborar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, pues demuestra ser un buen grupo, al presidir ella la junta directiva. Y todos trabajan activamente, para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.Jenny tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono que esparcirá  en sus cultivos de alverja, maíz y papa.
texts.en:
Jenny, 30, is a woman who is a great contributor. She lives in her mother's house together with her husband Atis (33). They have 3 small children. Jenny works planting potatoes, maize, peas and gladioli flowers, which are some of the best in the zone thanks to painstaking dedication she gives to them. What Jenny likes most about her work is planting the gladioli seeds and enjoying their exquisite smell. Nevertheless, she gets annoyed sometimes because her plots are so far away from her house. On top of her agricultural work she also raises 16 cows, which she has at the top of the village where she lives. Jenny's husband works as a driller in a mine in the south of Peru and comes home every 20 days. In the future Jenny is planning to continue to plant seeds, and for this wants to purchase more plots of productive land in her area. She also wants to build a house in the central city zone to install a food-sale business. This is the second time Jenny has had a loan from MFP and she is happy to work with the other members of her communal bank, as it has proved to be a good group, with Jenny presiding on the board of directors. All the members actively work to pay their repayments punctually. Jenny plans to invest this loan in the purchase of various sacks of fertiliser which she will scatter over her pea, maize and potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser to improve crops

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MANKO composé de (12) femmes a été formé depuis le 14/12/2008 au sortir de la formation du comité de gestion du Banc Villageois de TouB. Séras1 dont ledit groupe de solidarité fait partie.  Les membres du groupe sont du même quartier et ont longtemps travaillé ensemble depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont eu à mené beaucoup d'activités ensemble, elles font des tontines, des rencontres, etc. Ce qui justifie le nom du groupe "MANKO" qui signifie UNION. Ces femmes sont toutes mariées et mères au moins de 3 enfants, et leurs âges varient entre 30 et 55 ans. Les différentes activités pratiquées dans ce groupe sont l'embouche, la vente de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois,la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide,et le petit commerce. Ce présent crédit leur permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises pour développer leurs activités ci-dessus. 

Yaye Rama B., à l'extrême gauche de la photo, voilée en bleu et mise en médaillon est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de savon, de l'encens, et de pagnes. Avec son nouveau prêt elle pourra développer et faire la promotion de son activité commerciale. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.

nb. Binta Bâ n'étant pas bien visible sur la photo a été cochée comme absente.
texts.en:
The MANKO solidarity group, consisting of twelve (12) women, was formed on December 14, 2008 at the end of training by the management committee of the Banc Villageois of TouB. Seras1, to which the group belongs. The group members are from the same neighborhood and have been working side by side for many years. They are involved in a lot of activities together, including tontines, meetings, etc. This justifies the name chosen for the group, "Manko", which means UNION. All these women are married with at least three children, and their ages range from 30 to 55. The various activities of the group include livestock fattening, selling firewood and charcoal, processing and selling peanut oil, and small trade. This loan will allow them to stock up on supplies and develop these activities. Yaye Rama B. is in charge of the solidarity group. She appears at the extreme left of the picture, wearing a blue veil and shown in the inset. She is 50-years old, married and the mother of six children. She runs a small business selling soap, incense, and pagnes (colorful African cloth). Her new loan will allow her to develop and promote her commercial activities. Her goal is to increase her savings and contribute financially towards providing for the family’s needs such as food and healthcare. Note: Binta B. was marked as absent as she cannot be seen clearly on the picture.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and expand the solidarity group's commercial activities

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 44 años, es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo de 4 años en su casa que le heredaron sus padres. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a cultivar alfalfa en terrenos que posee, en donde cada mañana corta la alfalfa y venderla en grandes cantidades, a comerciantes y público en el mercado de su localidad. Por tanto procura siempre de cuidarlos de la plaga y otros insectos que afectan a la producción de esta planta. Una de las mayores ventajas de este producto es que produce 3 veces la misma semilla, es así que le resulta rentable este trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es comprar más extensiones de terreno para aumentar su producción de alfalfa. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar un área más  de terreno con alfalfa.
texts.en:
Amelia is 44 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 4 year old son in a house that she inherited from her parents. For more than 10 years Amelia has worked cultivating alfalfa on the plots of land she owns. Every morning she cuts the alfalfa and sells it in large quantities to store-keepers and the public in her regional market. For all that she earns she has to protect the plants from the plague and other insects that affect the production of this plant. One of the biggest advantages of alfalfa is that it produces 3 times the seeds, so that the work results in good profits. Amelia's biggest dream is to purchase more plots of land to increase her alfalfa production. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is very happy knowing that she has financial support. She has always demonstrated punctuality with her repayments, and she is thankful to be part of her communal group as all the members are very responsible and supportive people. Amelia will invest this loan in the purchase of sacks of fertiliser to plant another area of her land with alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Gregorio (59), y con sus 3 hijos.Se dedica a la siembra de diversos tubérculos (papa, oca, olluco, mashua), cebada y avena, además atiende en su negocio de venta de comestibles, mientras su esposo trabaja brindando servicio público y percibe mensualmente 1200 soles, por ser jubilado de un asentamiento minero. Con este dinero cubren los gastos domésticos, y los demás ingresos económicos los ahorran  para solventar la educación superior de sus hijos. Y como sus actividades son bastante rentables, viven cómodamente. Para más adelante tienen planeado continuar sembrando sobre todo papa y avena, que son los productos mas buscados  de esta zona, además desea mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda de comestibles.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y como siempre se siente segura de que los integrantes de su banco comunal, trabajaran responsablemente en el pago de sus cuotas.Lida tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  abono para sus cultivos y también adquirirá llantas para el auto de su esposo, y así espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a los viajeros.
texts.en:
Lida, 48 years old, lives in her own home with her husband Gregorio (59) and their 3 children. She works cultivating various tubers (potatoes, ocra, olluco, mashua), barley and wheat, and also has a food-sale business. Her husband works providing a public transport service and receives 1200 soles each monthly from a mining retirement settlement. With this money they cover the household costs and save the rest of their earnings to cover their childrens' higher education. As their activities are reasonably profitable, they live comfortably. In the future Lida and Gregorio plan to continue planting potatoes and wheat, which are the most sought-after products in the zone. They also want to improve the fittings of their food shop. This is the second time Lida has had a loan from MFP and as always she feels secure knowing that the members of her communal bank will work responsibly to repay their loans. Lida plans to invest this loan in the purchase of fertiliser for her crops and to acquire tyres for her husband's car, to hopefully offer a better service to travellers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser for crops and tyres for a car

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una mujer trabajadora, madre de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 57 años, desde hace varios años tiene una pequeña pulpería, que ha ido invirtiendo para lograr el mejoramiento económico de la familia. Su esposo trabaja en la reparación de radios.
Este negocio lo inicio con con ayuda de su hermana que envió remesa desde los Estados Unidos.
Lo que para ella fue de muchos beneficios, luego con financiamientos ha logrado aumentar más  productos, como cosméticos. Para vender más.
En estos tiempos esta difícil, todo ha incrementado, los cliente compran menos, muchas veces se van a las distribuidora lo que resulta mas conveniente para ellos pero no para nosotros.
Con este préstamo comprara quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, golosinas, a si como una variedad de cremas, pinturas de labios, vanidad, maquillaje, tintes de pelo, y otros que le generen ganancias. Para lograr aumentar las ventas, y pagar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a very hard-working woman and mother of 3 children. She is 57 years old and for various years has a small grocery store, which she has been investing in for improve her family's economic situation. Her husband works repairing radios. Maria began her business with the help of her sister, who sent her a consignment from the United States. This was very beneficial for Maria, and later with financing she was able to expand her products, such as cosmetics, to sell more. At the moment things are difficult, as prices have gone up, and customers are purchasing less. Many times people go to the distributors which is more convenient for them, but not for business owners. With this loan Maria wants to purchase quantities of rice, beans, sugar, maize, lollies, and a variety of creams, lipsticks, make-up and hair dyes, and other items that generate earnings, increase sales and allow her to pay her costs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items such as rice, beans, maize, sugar, and lollies.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 65 años, lleva 21 años separado de su pareja, pues no tiene hijos, por lo que vive sólo en su casa propia, en compañía de sus inquilinos.En su juventud  era operador de locomotoras y trailers, en un asentamiento minero del cual se jubiló y de inmediato se fue a vivir a su ciudad natal. Tenia temor de  regresar a trabajar en  la agricultura, pero luego de un tiempo se decidió, y aplico las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre y ahora es uno de los mejores productores, pues desde hace 8 años cultiva  diferentes tipos de tubérculos, además de avena (pastizal), en sus terrenos propios. Lo que más le gusta es trabajar sus tierras y mantenerlas siempre limpias y verdes, porque así auguran una cosecha exitosa, sin embargo, le disgusta no contar con la ayuda de nadie, por eso piensa arrendar todos sus terrenos a su hermano, además quiere comprar cantidad de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y conejos pues quiere  instalar su granja.Es la décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y como es parte de la junta directiva, se siente contento de seguir trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, porque son personas responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Marcelo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos en sus cultivos, pues desea mejorar la calidad, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Marcelo, 65, has been separated from his partner for 21 years, but he doesn't have children so he lives alone in his own house in the company of his tenants. In his youth he was a train and truck operator in a mine site, from which he retired and immediately when to live in the city of his birth. Marcelo was afraid of going back to work in agriculture, but arrived at a point when he decided to do so and applied the agricultural techniques that his father taught him. Now he is one of the best producers in the region. For 8 years Marcelo has cultivated different types of tubers, as well as wheat (grass) on his own plots of land. What he enjoys most about his work is working on the land and keeping his crops clean and green, as this assures him of an excellent harvest. Nevertheless, he doesn't like not having anyone to help him and so he is thinking about renting his land out to his brother. Marcelo also wants to purchase a quantity of small animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens and rabbits, and to install a barn. This is the tenth time he has had a loan from MFP, and as he is part of the board of directors he feels happy to continue working with the members of his communal bank as they are very responsible people. Marcelo plans to invest this loan in the purchase of sacks of fertiliser to scatter on his crops as he wants them to be of a better quality, and in this way continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser to improve crops

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es: Basilio tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja y su hija en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 8 años cultiva verduras y hortalizas, en toda la extensión de terreno que posee. Su esposa, es su principal apoyo en esta actividad, desde entonces ambos cuidan sus plantaciones de plagas, así como dar el adecuado riego y fertilización, esencial para obtener una buena cosecha. Esta labor tendrá su recompensa en la cosecha  ya que  puede ofrecer a los comerciantes mayoristas a un precio regular en el mercado de su zona. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Basilio is 38 years old and lives with his partner and daughter in a rented house. For mO. than 8 years he has cultivated vegetables across all the land he owns. His wife is his principle support in this activity, and both of them protect the crops from plagues of insects and give them adequate fertiliser so that they have a good harvest. This work is rewarded during the harvest as Basilio can offer wholesale business people a regular price in the zone's market. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is very content to know that he has the support of a financial institution. Basilio has always proved to be responsible with his repayments, and is thankful to be part of this communal group because all of the members are responsible and supportive. He will invest this loan in the purchase of sacks of fertiliser and seeds for the next sowing.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser and seeds

loans.name: Sope Cheikh Sadbou Aïdara Group

texts.fr:
le Groupe de solidarité SOPE CHEIKH SADBOU AÏDARA est composé de (12) personnes, il a vu sa naissance depuis le 14/12/2008 au sortir de la formation du comité de gestion du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite (TOUB. SERAS1). Elles sont toutes des femmes mariées et mères d'au moins 03 enfants, elles sont âges de 30 à 60 ans. Elles sont du même quartier et ont longtemps travaillé ensemble depuis plusieurs années, Les activités dans ce groupe sont l'embouche et le petit commerce. Ce nouveau prêt leur permettra de renforcer leurs activité commerciales.

La présidente Sokhna D., accroupie au milieu et mise en médaillon est âgée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et du petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter des moutons qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 5 mois, elle va également acheter des effets vestimentaires. 
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
The SOPE CHEIKH SADBOU AÏDARA cooperative group is made up of 12 women, formed on 12/14/2008 out of the management committee of the Banc Villageois which supports it (TOUB. SERAS1). The members are all married and mothers of at least three children, and range from 30 to 60 years old. They live in the same neighborhood and have worked together for several years. The group’s activities are fattening of livestock and smallscale trade. This new loan will allow them to strengthen their business activities. The president, Sokhna D., seated at bottom center of the photo and pictured again at bottom right, is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She fattens sheep and has a small clothing business. With her new loan she plans to buy sheep that she will fatten and resell after five months. She will also buy clothing for her business. Her goal is to support her husband in the care of the family and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the business activities of the cooperative group

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 20 años de experiencia sembrando diferentes productos de su zona, especialmente las hortalizas, como: zanahoria, coliflor, cebolla. En tanto su familia, también lo apoya en esta actividad, ya que juntos tienen el mismo propósito, que es generar las ganancias necesarias. Es por que cada miembro se turna para cuidar sus cultivos y asegurar que crezcan saludables, de eso depende para tener una buena cosecha. Afirma que le gusta mucho esta labor aunque un poco sacrificada y a veces  imprevisible por las condiciones climáticas, pero su recompensa lo recibe cuando ve las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de su producción. En el futuro desea  tener más extensiones de terreno. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Daniel is 42 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 3 children. He has 20 years of experience growing various products of his area, especially vegetables , such as carrots,cauliflower, onions. His family supports this activity since together they have the same goal which is to make the necessary income. Each person takes turns taking care of the fields to make sure that they grow well, since a good harvest depends on this. He affirms that he likes this work even though he needs to make sacrifices and is at the mercy of the climate. He gets his reward when he receives the profits from the sales of his production. He wants to have more farm land in the future. This is the second loan with MFP and he is very happy knowing that he has financial support due to his always being a responsible payer. He is also very pleased being part of the community group because all the members are responsible persons and very supportive. With the proceeds from the loan he will buy sacks of fertilizer to be able to continue to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de  su pareja Betty (36), y 2 de sus 3 hijos, pues el mayor trabaja de manera independiente.Este trabajador hombre se dedica al cultivo de papa, olluco y avena (pastizal), desde hace 20 años, también trabaja brindando servicio público a bordo de su auto ,que cubre una ruta de su ciudad, mientras su esposa administra su tienda de venta de comestibles, y él también atiende este negocio durante los días que descansa. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar su producción de papa porque la traslada directamente a los mercados de la ciudad, y le pagan mucho mas, ya que los tubérculos que siembra son de calidad y de diferentes variedades. Sus producciones son muy solicitadas en los mercados de la capital, por eso considera que sus labor es muy rentable, por lo que este año se proyecta en sembrar todas sus chacras de papa de una nueva variedad, asimismo, quiere instalar una graja de ovinos, aprovechando que ya tiene varias cabezas de carnero, para venderlos al por mayor.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y esta muy satisfecho de trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo  comunal, pues ya los conoce y sabe que son puntuales y responsables con el pago de sus cuotas.Moisés tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  tres carneros que sacrificara para vender la carne en su negocio, y también comprará productos comestibles para abastecer su tienda que administra con su esposa.
texts.en:
Moisés is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Betty, 36, and two of his three children, as the third lives on his own. Moisés is a hardworking farmer who has been growing potatoes and oats for over 20 years. He also uses his car as a taxi providing transportation throughout the city while his wife works in their grocery shop. On his days off Moisés helps in the shop. His favorite thing about his work is harvesting the potatoes because he brings them directly to the markets in the city. His crops bring a good price because he grows popular varieties using high-quality seeds. His crops are very sought-after in the markets, and so his work is very profitable. Because of this, this year he plans to plant a new variety of potatoes as well as to construct a pen for sheep to raise and sell wholesale, as he already raises cattle. This is his second loan from MFP, and he is very satisfied with the work of the members of his communal bank. He already knows them well and trusts that they are responsible and punctual with repayments of their loans. Moisés will invest this loan in the purchase of three rams to butcher and sell their meat in his shop. He will also buy merchandise to stock the shop he runs with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rams and merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Sope Serigne Barra Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de Solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BARRA est composé de 09 femme qui sont toutes issues du même quartier, elles sont pratiquement toutes mariées et mère d'au moins de 2 enfants. Elles sont âgées de 35 à 55 ans et leur activité principale est le petit commerce de légumes et de poissons. Elles ont formé leur groupe depuis le 14 décembre 2008, le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois qui les abrite et portant le nom de TOUBA SERAS1. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par proximité ce qui fait qu'elles cultive un bon esprit de solidarité et d'entre-aide dans le groupe. 

Mame Daro N., debout sur la photo en troisième position à partir de la gauche et en médaillon en bas de la photo à droite, est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est née le 03 octobre 1968, elle a 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est vendeuse de poissons, au marché central de son quartier elle a installé une table où elle étale et vend sa marchandise. Son ambition d'une part, est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple la santé et la nourriture et d'autre part renforcer le niveau de ses épargne.
texts.en:
The SOPE SERIGNE BARRA cooperative group is made up of 9 women from the same neighborhood, almost all married and the mother of at least two children. They range in age from 35 to 55 years, and their main business is the sale of vegetables and fish. They formed their group on December 14, 2008, at the same time that the Banc Villageois that supports them was formed (called TOUBA SERAS1). They came together through affinity and location, which has helped them to cultivate a good spirit of solidarity and support within the group. Mame Daro N., standing third from left in the photo and also pictured at bottom right, is the leader of the cooperative group. She was born on October 3, 1968, is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 4 dependent children. She sells fish in the central market of her neighborhood, where she has a table to display her products. Her goals are to help improve living conditions for her family, for example their health and nutrition, and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the business activities of the cooperative group

loans.name: Isac

texts.es: Isac tiene una pequeña bodega hace 5 años que le permite cubrir los gastos en casa  pero como es un hombre emprendedor diariamente compra y vende pasteles en un mercado grande de Vitarte en donde de forma ambulante los vende. Sus 3 hijos que aun están en el colegio apoyan con este trabajo. A Isac le gustaría ver a sus 3 hijos con estudios profesionales y por eso trabaja día a día, Además tiene como objetivo tener su propia panadería. Isaac agradece los el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
For the last five years Isac has had a small shop which helps him meet his household expenses. But, since he is an entrepreneurial man, he also works every day as a street vendor buying and selling cakes in the main market of Vitarte. His three high school-aged children help him with this work. Isac would like to see his three children be educated as professionals and this is why he works hard every day. He also would like to own his own bakery. Isac is grateful for the support of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Luciana Zunilda

texts.es:
La señora Luciana Zunilda R. , es excelente persona,trabajadora  madre de 4 hermosas criaturas se dedica a la compra,ventas de artículos  alimenticios bebidas en general, y quiere incursionar en la venta de calzados.
Ella quiere tener en su negocio calzados de vaR. tipos y modelos, y para comprarlos solicita el préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ella esta con el negocio buen tiempo y cuenta con clientela formada, y esta muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya que  mediante los ingresos que obtuvo con su negocio pudo educar a sus hijos de la mejor manera posible.
texts.en:
Luciana Zunilda R. is an excellent person. She is a hardworking mother of 4 beautiful children who buys and sells a variety of groceries and would like to begin to sell shoes. Luciana would like to start a business selling a variety of types and styles of shoes, and to buy them she is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya. She has had her business for a long time and has many loyal customers. She is very happy with her work since the income it yields enables her to provide the best education possible for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Dios Es Nuestro Ayudador Group

texts.en:
Altane is the coordinator of her group, Dios es nuestro ayudador 3, which means "God our helper." Her group consists of 5 Haitian women. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children.

Altane is excited to be seeking her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. More specifically, she will use the proceeds to sell clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She will in turn save any profits and strive to continually improve her business with additional loans and savings.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based around tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing clothes, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Gisella Natividad

texts.es:
Gisella de 35 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil(zona urbana, su originalidad fue que habían muchas flores Orquídeas), ella vende productos Avon (empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras para que sean vendedoras potenciales). 

Una de las hijas de Gisella al ver la necesidad económica empezó a vender perfumes y cremas en el colegio, cuando Gisella se dio cuenta ella decidió hablar con su hija para que no lo haga mas y Gisella empezó a vender. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ha tenido ingresos para mantener a su familia, vende perfumes, cremas, maquillaje etc. 

Para poder continuar con el negocio de Avon ella necesita comprar con el préstamo cremas, perfumes. En el futuro ella quiere seguir trabajando y comprar un carro para hacer expreso.
texts.en:
Gisella is 35 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area where many orchids once grew. She sells products manufactured by Avon, a company that helps enterprising women reach their potential as sales representatives.

Due to financial necessity, one of Gisella daughters began selling perfumes and crèmes at school. Gisella could not resist any longer, so she decided to talk with her daughter who gave up her sales so that Gisella could start selling these products. Over time and with effort, she had the income to support her family. She sells perfumes, crèmes, make-up, and other items.

In order to continue her Avon business, Gisella needs a loan to buy crèmes and perfumes. In the future she wants to continue working and buy a car so that she can get around faster.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crèmes and perfumes

loans.name: Zaida Lideth

texts.es: La señora Zaida Lideth tiene 24 años, cuenta con un kiosco que lo tiene ubicado en el colegio de El Tamarindo en el cual vende todo tipo de golosinas y refrescos a los alumnos y profesores. Ella  madre de 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja como empacador de sal en una salina, por lo que siempre se han caracterizado por ser personas trabajadoras que se desempeñan en mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia. Está solicitando su primer crédito, el que utilizara en la compra de productos para su local, con el objetivo de aumentar sus ventas y ganancias, y de esta manara mantener los gastos del hogar y la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Zaida Lideth is 24 years old and has a kiosk at El Tamarindo School where she sells all kinds of candy and soft drinks to the students and teachers. She is the mother of one son. Her husband works as a packer at a salt mine. Zaida and her husband are known for being hardworking people who strive to improve the living conditions for their family.

She is requesting her first loan so that she can buy products for her business in hopes of increasing her sales and her income. This will enable her to cover the household expenses and pay for her son’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy products for her business

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Socorro se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en la vía publica como: pollo frito, tripitas (vísceras de pollo) hace 15 años, Ella tiene 5 hijos pero solo 3 están bajo su cuidado, Como es separada de su esposo y no tiene apoyo económico, tiene que trabajar diariamente con la ayuda de sus hijos.  Socorro es una mujer optimista, así que el préstamo que se le otorgo está destinado a la compra de insumos para su negocio.
Ella esta agradecida a Edaprospo y Kiva por la confianza depositada en ella.
texts.en:
Socorro has been selling fast food on a public street for 15 years. She sells fried chicken and “tripitas” (chicken intestines). Socorro has five children, but only three of them are still under her care. She is separated from her husband and he does not provide financial assistance. Therefore, she must work every day to support her children.

Socorro is an optimistic woman and will use this loan to buy supplies for her business. She is grateful to EDAPROSPO and Kiva for placing their trust in her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her fast food business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su octavo ciclo dentro del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una de las señora muy activas y con ganas de superarse constantemente es Paula A.  con 32 años de edad y  tiene 5 hijos, se dedica a la profesión modista.
Ella  confecciona ropas sobre medidas para damas y caballeros, además fabrica sabanas y manteles para mesas y los vende comercios de la zona, y a sus compañeras de comité.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas en gran cantidad y guata para la fabricación de edredones y sabanas.
texts.en:
This existing committee is in its eighth loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program.

One of these active women with a constant desire to succeed is Paula A.. She is 32 years old, has five children, and works as a professional seamstress. Paula makes customized clothing for women and men. In addition, she manufactures bed sheets and tablecloths and sells them to businesses in the area and to her fellow committee members.

She is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of fabrics and cotton for making comforters and bed sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & cotton

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalia, D. 51 años, enviudó hace 19 años, tiene 7 hijos, pero sólo vive con 2 D. ellos, en su casa que es  propia.DesD. hace 30 años, se dedica a cultivar papa, cebada, olluco y habas, también cría animales (como carneros, vacas, cerdos, asnos, gallinas y cuyes), los cuales venD. para cubrir alguna eventualidad que se le presente, o para realizar sus compras semanales en el mercado. Además cuando se organiza  alguna actividad  importante en su zona, los sacrifica para su venta y se genera mayores ganancias. Lo  que más le gusta es cuidar sus cultivos, y sabe que su producción  le genera buenas ganancias, además  se esfuerza por salir adelante, por eso  cada mañana se despierta a las 5 D. la mañana para atender a sus animales y luego D. preparar sus alimentos, sale a trabajar con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Para más adelante tiene planeado instalar un negocio D. venta D. productos comestibles y verduras en su casa recién construida.Es  la décima primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  conoce perfectamente la metodología D. trabajo D. su grupo comunal, por lo que le gusta laborar D. manera activa, junto a los demás integrantes, que son personas solidarias y responsables en el pago D. sus cuotas.Rosalia tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra D.  diversas verduras que llevará a vender a los mercados D. la selva central peruana, y D. esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 51 years old. She has been widowed for 19 years and lives in her own home. Of her seven children, only two still live with her. Rosalia has been growing potatoes, barley, ulluco, and beans for 30 years. In addition she raises animals such as sheep, cows, pigs, donkeys, chickens, and guinea pigs and sells them whenever she encounters a financial emergency or has to do her weekly shopping at the market. If there is an important event taking place in the area, she takes advantage of the opportunity by slaughtering some her animals and selling them to earn additional income. What she enjoys most is caring for her crops because she knows that her production will result in good earnings. In order to stay ahead, she wakes up at 5am each morning to tend to her animals and prepare their food. Her children help with the work. In the future, Rosalia plans to open a business selling food products and vegetables from her home that was recently built.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. Rosalia knows very well the work methodology of her Communal Bank. She enjoys being active with the other members, who are supportive individuals and responsible with their loan payments. Rosalia plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of different vegetables to sell at the markets in the central Peruvian jungle. This will enable her to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 40 años, es separada y vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 8 años trabaja intensamente en la agricultura, así como en la crianza de animales como vacas, ovejas y cuyes. De esta manera extrae la leche de sus vacas, que luego son vendidas a sus vecinos y amigos de su comunidad, en tanto sus hijos la ayudan vendiendo la leche en otras localidades. Además de vender leche, también vende el cuajo, que es donde recibe también ganancias. Por tal motivo, espera continuar con esta actividad, además desea adquirir más vacas para aumentar la producción leche. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono que le servirá para sembrar alfalfa, ya que es forraje importante para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old, separated from her spouse, and lives in her own home with her children. She has been farming intensively for more than eight years and also raises cows, sheep, and guinea pigs. The milk that is extracted from her cows is sold to her neighbors and friends in the community. Her children help sell the milk in other locations. She also sells rennet (an enzyme produced in the cow’s stomach that is used in cheese making) to earn extra income. Gloria wants to acquire more cows so that she can increase her milk production and continue her business activity.

This is her second loan with MFP. She has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. In addition, Gloria enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. The loan she requested will be used to buy sacks of compost for growing alfalfa, which is an important food source for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Blasina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres D. Valor 1 & 2 (Women of courage). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and a child. 

Blasina is excited to be taking her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear and selling them in her neighborhood and some companies around her area. She will use the profits to improve her business and help her husband to change her home from wood to concrete block.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Hugo Orlando

texts.es:
Hugo de 36 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil(zona urbana, su originalidad fue que habían muchas flores Orquídeas), el tiene una tienda de vivirse, vende todo tipos de alimentos como arroz, cereales, bebidas etc. 

Antes de tener su tienda el tuvo un puesto de comida de “fritadas” (comida típica del Ecuador, con chancho, mote y cebollas). Con unos ahorros que el tenia decidio comprar unos víveres y venderlos para pasar mas tiempo con sus dos hijos, por esa buena decisión ahora tiene una tienda de víveres, trabaja desde las 05h30ma hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.     

Para poder tener mas ingresos en su casa el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un local de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Hugo is 36 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area where many orchids once grew. He has a general store where he sells all types of food such as rice, cereals, beverages, and other items.

Prior to having his store, Hugo operated a food stand where he sold “fritadas” (a traditional Ecuadorian dish made of pork, corn, and onions). Using his savings, he decided to buy a few provisions to sell so that he could spend more time with his two children. This turned out to be a good decision because he now has his own store where he works every day from 5:30am to 10pm.

In order to generate more household income he wants to use this loan to buy rice, beverages, and canned goods for his store. In the future he wants to open a fast food shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beverages, and canned goods

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se denomina Prosperidad y se encuentra, en su 10  ciclo del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras.
Este grupo conforman señoras muy activas quienes se comprometieron a trabajar y ayudarse entre todas ante cualquier situación.
  En el grupo se encuentra la señora Georgina F., ella tiene 46 años  y 4 hijos,  se dedica a vender mercaderías que trae de la ciudad de Clorinda (Argentina). Ella viaja  varias veces al mes para traer las mercaderías que los clientes le piden.
Los enlatados como dulces, mayonesas, lácteos, aceites y otros productos no perecederos son los productos que ella vende en mayor cantidad. 
Actualmente se encuentra satisfecha con esta actividad ya que ayuda a su familia a llevar una mejor vida.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de enlatados en general como de  dulce, aceites, alfajores, y otros.
texts.en:
This existing committee is named “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) and in its tenth loan cycle as part of the Committee of Enterprising Women Program. The group consists of active women who commit to working together and helping one another in any situation.

One of the members of this group is Georgina F.. She is 46 years old and has four children. Georgina sells merchandise that she brings with her from the city of Clorinda, Argentina. She travels several times a month so that she can bring back the goods that have been ordered by her customers. These products include canned goods, candy, mayonnaise, dairy products, oil, and other non-perishable products that can be sold in large quantities.

Georgina is currently happy with her business since it has helped her family have a better life. She is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, candy, oil, shortbread cookies, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase canned goods, candy, oil, shortbread cookies, and other items

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises, de 30 años vive con su pareja Julia (34), y sus 2 pequeños hijos en una casa alquilada, ubicada cerca de sus terrenos arrendados.Cuando se siente cansado, su esposa es quien lo motiva a continuar buscando el bienestar de sus hijos, es así que juntos llevan 4 años dedicados a cultivar papa y largas extensiones de avena (pastizal), que vende por paquetes en los mercados de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar, porque observa la recompensa de todo el esfuerzo desempeñado en las buenas ganancias, también, le gusta cortar las avenas, y comercializarlas, sin embargo, le incomoda pagar precios exuberantes para trasladar sus cosechas. Además asegura que su oficio es bastante rentable, por lo que viene ahorrando, pues con el tiempo, quiere comprar sus propias chacras y construir su casa de material noble, para que su familia viva cómodamente.Es  la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra entusiasmado de continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal, porque todos los integrantes son personas puntuales y responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Ulises tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, principalmente de pastizales, ya que desea mejorar la calidad de sus producciones.
texts.en:
Ulises is 30 years old and lives with partner Julia, age 34, and their two small children in a rented house located near the farmland they have leased. Whenever he fells tired, his wife encourages him to continue providing for the welfare of their children. Together they have worked four years growing potatoes and oats on large tracts of land and selling them in bundles at the markets in the city. What he enjoys most is harvesting because he sees the reward for all of his hard work in the result of good earnings. Ulises also likes cutting the oats and selling them. However, he is bothered by paying exorbitant prices to transport his crops. He feels secure that his work is profitable, so he is saving money so that he can eventually buy his own land and build a house of solid materials so that his family can live comfortably.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is excited about continuing to work with his Communal Bank because all of the members are prompt and responsible with their loan payments. Ulises plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of several sacks of compost to apply to his crops, primarily on the oat pastures, so that he can improve the quality of his production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Martiza tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos en una casa que le heredaron sus suegros. Hace más de 6 años trabaja cultivando papa, maíz, así también verduras, como: cebolla y lechuga, sobre terrenos que posee. Desde entones cada mañana, en compañía de sus esposo van al campo a cuidar sus plantaciones, de plagas o de alguna variación climática que perjudican la producción. Paralelamente cría cuyes y pollos, en la granja que tiene y cada semana los vende, así logra tener otro ingreso extra. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza,  porque le permite estar en el campo y apreciar del bello paisaje que rodea su comunidad, además la recompensa lo obtiene cuando vende lo que ha cosechado. Su meta es tener mas extensiones de terreno, y un establo más grande para vacas y cuyes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Maritza is 23 years old and lives with her husband and their two small children in a house that they inherited from her in-laws. For more than six years she has been growing potatoes, corn, as well as vegetables such as onions and lettuce on her own land. Each morning, she and her husband go to the fields to care for their crops and protect them from pests and occasional weather changes that can hurt production. In addition, Maritza raises guinea pigs and chickens on her farm and sells them each week to earn extra income. She enjoys her work tremendously because it allows her to be in the country and appreciate the beautiful landscape that surrounds her community. In addition, she is rewarded when her crops are sold. Her goal is to acquire more tracts of land and build a larger stable for housing cows and guinea pigs.

This is her second loan with MFP. Maritza has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of sacks of compost for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: La Sra. Clotilde invierte el préstamo en los insumos para preparar diversos tipos  de refrescos y de diferentes sabores como: Chicha morada, maracuyá, manzana y otros. Además su hermana la ayudo a conseguir un puesto así que también se dedica a la venta de ropa ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos por los cuales tiene que salir adelante. Los ingresos le permiten aportar con los gastos en casa, además su esposo lo apoya en todo momento. La Sra. Clotilde esta agradecida  por el préstamo, además es puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Clotilde will use the loan to buy ingredients to prepare various kinds of drinks with different flavors such as: Chica morada (a typical maize-derived drink prepared in Peru with purple corn), passion fruit, apple and others. On top of this, her sister helped her finding a job, and so she also dedicates herself to clothes selling. She is married and has 3 children she needs to provide for. The income helps her contributing to the household expenses, and her husband always helps her however he can. Clotilde is thankful for the loan, and she is punctual with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying pigs, milk, sausages, drinks, sugar, coffee, water, fruit, and flavorings

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 4 Group

texts.en:
Bibiana is the coordinator of her group Mujeres luchadoras 4 (Fighting women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are building her house, being a single mom and wanting to give her family a better home.

Bibiana is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying blankets, clothes and shoes. She will use the profits to change some windows in her house. In the future, she wants to improve her house and she is very sure that with Esperanza and the loans she will have a better business and a safer home.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. . This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy clothes, blankets and shoes

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 47 años vive con su pareja  Haydee (47) y sus 3 hijos,  en su casa que es propia, en una apacible zona de la sierra peruana.Junto a su esposa, todos los días coordinan desde muy temprano, cuales son las chacras que  necesitan ser trabajadas. Ya llevan 15 años en la agricultura sembrando avena (pastizal), papa, olluco y oca, ambos cuentan con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos, paralelamente crían animales (carneros y asnos), que le ayudan a trasladar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para cuidar adecuadamente sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta es regar sus cultivos, porque sabe que con el agua se agiliza el desarrollo de sus frutos, y las ganancias son bastante rentables y cubren sus gastos domésticos y la educación de sus hijos. Como es una mujer emprendedora para más adelante tiene planeado continuar  sembrando estos productos que son oriundos del Perú.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le agrada mucho saber que continuará trabajando con los integrantes de su grupo  comunal, ahora que acordaron sacar el crédito para un corto tiempo, debido a que son personas responsables y solidarias en el pago de sus cuotas.Víctor tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos en esta campaña, para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Victor, 47, lives with his partner, Haydee (47) and their 3 children in their own house in a peaceful area of the Peruvian sierra. He and his wife decide very early every morning which of the fields need to be worked. They have been farming for 15 years growing grains (fodder ), potatoes, olluco and oca (Andean tubers), and they count on eventually having the help of their children. They also raise animals (rams and donkeys) and this helps them pay for the farm supplies they need to take adequate care of their crops. What they like the most is to water their plants because they know that water helps strengthen their crops, and the earnings from the farm are high enough to cover their household expenses and their children’s schooling. Since Haydee is a hard-working woman, in the future she plans to keep growing these crops that are native to Peru. This is the second time that Victor has a loan with MFP and he is happy to know that he will continue working with the members of the communal group since they agreed to take out a loan for a short time. They are responsible and supportive members in the repayment of the loan. Victor plans to invest the money in the purchase of some bags of fertilizer that he will spread over the plants this season so that the quality of the crops will be improved.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the productivity of his fields

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo tiene 69 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de  48 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público. En un inicio tenía que arrendar un carro, pero con el pasar del tiempo logró comprarse uno, actualmente contrata un chofer para que realice la rutas indicadas, siendo él mismo quien administra sus ganancias. Procura cada cierto tiempo, darle mantenimiento necesario para que su vehículo este en optimas condiciones. Durante este tiempo de trabajo, le ha sido muy rentable por lo que desea mas adelante adquirir otro carro. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, además le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la reparación de su carro.
texts.en:
Segundo, age 69, lives with his wife and their three children in his own house. He has been providing public transportation services for over 48 years. In the beginning he had to rent a car. But, with the passage of time, he was able to buy one. He currently hires a driver to drive the indicated routes. Segundo manages his earnings himself. He tries to perform the needed maintenance every so often so that his vehicle is in optimal condition. This era of work has been very profitable for him. That is why he wishes to get another car later on. This is his fifth loan with MFP. It pleases him to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are very responsible people, and they are very supportive. He will use the loan he is requesting to repair his car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his car

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar de 54 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, alrededor del rió Guayas, y como una ecología en disolución), el tiene un taller de cerrajería para mantener a su esposa y cuatro hijos. 

Desde pequeño Cesar aprendió cerrajería gracias a su papa que le enseño, cuando fue creciendo y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que hacer lo que desde pequeño había aprendido, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener sus propias herramientas suficientes. Pero como el taller lo tiene en la casa el quiere readecuar su casa y construir con el préstamo comprar cemento, bloques, arena. 

En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio para tener mas clientela y asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 54 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area situated near the Guayas River that has a deteriorating ecosystem. He operates a locksmith shop in order to support his wife and four children.

From a young age, Cesar learned about the locksmith business from his father. Growing up he had few opportunities, so he ended up doing what his father had taught him. Over time and with effort, Cesar was able to acquire his own tools that were sufficient for the job. In order to install a workshop in his house, he needs to do some remodeling work and will use this loan to buy cement, blocks, and sand.
