In the future, he wants to expand his business and have more customers so that he can secure his family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that he can build a space in his house for his locksmith shop

loans.name: Fanny Carolina

texts.es:
La Sra. Fanny Carolina G.  es cliente nueva de nuestra entidad, es casada y vive en casa propia. 
La titular cuenta con un restaurant hace mas de 3 años, dicho  negocio se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad de Luque contando con muy buena ubicación y clientela formada a la fecha.
La  titular ha retirado dicho préstamo para la compra de mercaderías, entre bebidas e ingredientes para los comestibles que ella ofrece para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Fanny Carolina Gimenz is a new customer of our institution. She is married and she owns the house she lives in. For more than 3 years she has been running a restaurant, located in a very good spot in Luque’s city center, and in time she has gained constant customers. She has requested the loan to buy some products, such as drinks and ingredients to prepare the dishes she offers in her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks and ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Albin

texts.es:
Albin N. A. es un joven de 23 años de edad  el cual vive con sus Padres en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos.


La familia de Albin se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura, pero desde muy joven su espíritu de emprendedor lo llevo a querer tener su propio negocio. Y ya hace 3 anos que monto con su padre su propio Café Internet. Este negocio  le permite tener una fuente de ingreso y seguir sus estudios.

Por ahora Albin  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢500 000 (quinientos  mil colones) para comprar una impresora Multifuncional que le permitirá expandir su negocio y abastecer las necesidades de la población de su comunidad, que le han mencionado la falta que hace este servicio. 

Albin  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su primer préstamo y asegura que será de mucho beneficio para su negocio, y espera seguir participando más activamente con la empresa de crédito Comunal.
texts.en:
Albin N. A. is a 23 year old young man who lives with his parents in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is located 150km south of the San José province, the capital of Costa Rica. It is 850m above sea level. Vegetables and coffee are grown here in addition to raising beef cattle and pigs. Albin's family has been in the farming business his whole life, but from a very early age Albin's entrepreneurial spirit has been his motivation for wanting to have his own business. Three years ago, with his father's help, he opened his own internet café. Albin is requesting a loan for 500,000 colones (Costa Rica's currency) to buy a multi functional printer that will allow him to expand his business and to meet the needs of the people in his community that have called his attention to the lack of this service. Albin is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the 100 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he is sure that it will be very beneficial for his business. He hopes to continue as an active member of this communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a multi functional printer

loans.name: Dalila Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora Dalila Muñoz es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo considerada esta ciudad como la tercera ciudad mas importante económicamente, sus iglesias son muy hermosas al igual que sus ríos, y su deliciosa gastronomía.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de toda clase de ropa hace 9 años,  vende en algunas ciudades de la costa, y  también entrega los  pedidos a sus clientes.

La Señora. Dalila tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 39, 37, 36 y 27 años de edad, tres de sus hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente, solo su tercer hijo es soltero y es quien le ayuda económicamente en su hogar, su esposo es jubilado, no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando.

Se encuentra en su doceavo ciclo y los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, chompas, sobrecamas, cobijas.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalila Muñoz is a member of the Loma de la Cruz (Hill of the Cross) Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca. It is considered to be the third most important city economically. Its churches are very beautiful as are its rivers and its delicious food. She has been selling all types of clothes for nine years. She sells in some of the cities on the coast. She also delivers the orders to her customers. Dalila is 57 years old, married, and has four children. The children are 39, 37, 36, and 27 years old. Three of her children are married and live independently. Only her third child is single. This child helps the household economically. Her husband is retired, she does not have her own house, and she rents where she lives. She is in her twelfth cycle. The loans have helped her business grow. She will use the new loan to buy pants, sweaters, bedspreads, and blankets. Her goal is to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, sweaters, bedspreads, and blankets

loans.name: El Shadai Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario El Shadai esta ubicado en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, esta formado por dos hombres y una mujer quienes se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, su deseo como grupo es obtener un prestamo para sacar adelante sus negocios, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el joven Dany fabricio O. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la venta de achineria en un puesto ubicado frente a la empresa tropigas, ahi vende gorras, fajas, controles universales para tv. entre otras cosas. el credito lo utilizara para comprar fajas y accesorios para uso en el hogar, Dany vive solo.

la joven Sandra Marina G. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con una amiga, Sandra es 
una persona trabajadora y muy deseosa de salir adelante. su sueño es comprarse una casa.
el creedito lo va a utilizar para invertirlos en accesorios para dama como ser: colas, ganchos, lociones, shampoo y otras cosas que se venden en la temporada, Sandra realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años dice que le ha ido muy bien y su negocio va creciendo dia a dia.
 
el joven Selvin Antonio R. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Selvin no siguio sus estudios y se le hace dificil conseguir trabajo en una empresa privada, por esta razon que decidio abrir su negocio propio con la ayuda de sus padres, ahora dice que le va bien y que su deseo es tener mas dinero para poder invertir en su negocio.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa interior, pantalones y blusas, el vive en la colonia Buena
Vista y su negocio esta ubicado en frente de la farmacia M. en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
The El Shadai Communal Bank is located in the old market in San Lorenzo. It is comprised of two men and one woman, who have known each other for a long time. Their wish as a group is to get a loan in order to get ahead in their businesses. What follows are details about the different activities they do. Dany Fabricio Osorta is a 25 year old, single young man. He sells low-cost consumer goods in a stall located in front of the Tropigas Company. He sells hats, belts, and universal controls for TV, among other things. He will use the loan to buy belts and accessories for home use. Dany lives alone. Sandra Marina G. is a single, 24 year old young woman. She does not have children, and she lives with a girlfriend. Sandra is a hard-working person who really wants to get ahead. Her dream is to buy a house. She will use the loan to buy women’s accessories like ponytail holders, hairpins, shampoo, and other things that are seasonally sold. Sandra has been doing this activity for three years. She says that it has gone very well for her. Her business is growing day to day. Selvin Antonio R. is a single, 22 year old young man. He has been selling clothes for three years. Selvin did not continue his education, and it is difficult for him to get work in a private company. That is why he decided to open his own business with his parents’ help. He says that now it is going well for him. He wishes to have more money to be able to invest in his business. He will use the loan to buy underwear, pants, and blouses. He lives in the Buena Vista settlement. His business is located in front of the M. Pharmacy in the city of San Lorenzo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, hats, belts, perfume, lotions, and women's accessories

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en: Nicholus K. is a 26-year-old single man. He owns and operates a retail shop where he sells detergents, soaps, bread, sugar, soda, and rice. He also owns a grocery shop where he mainly sells onions. He has learned how to manage his finances by saving his money with Mumo group in Faulu Kenya. Being a member of the group, he can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya. Therefore, he has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to add inventory of soda and sugar. This will be his second loan from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his business and employ people.

loans.use: To purchase soda and sugar

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 44-year-old lady who is married to a farmer. She sells scrap metals which are later recycled. In additon, she sells fruit to earn extra income. Regina is a mother of four, and she works hard to provide a quality education for her two children who are in school. For this reason, she wants to stabilize her business to increase her income so that she can afford school fees. She has been an active member of Ngumbau group in Faulu Kenya, whose members are responsible for any member who takes out a loan. She is requesting 25,000 KES through the group. She wants to use the loan to buy more oranges for resale. In ten years, she wants to own a truck to transport fruit to the market.

loans.use: To buy oranges for resale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 47 años, comparte su vida con sus 3 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde que era niña, fue criada por su familia que se dedicaba a la agricultura y la ganadería. Es así que aprendió todos los secretos para cultivar maíz, papa, arveja, habas entre otros, asimismo tiene animales las cuales los cría en su establo. Esta es su forma de vida, además las actividades que realiza le permiten tener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, adicionalmente vende leche, que extrae de sus vacas y lo que cosecha. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, de esa manera se mantiene unida esa familia. Su mayor anhelo es incrementar la cantidad de  animales, entre ellas vacas de buena raza, que puedan producir más litros de leche. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, es una de las socias más activas y puntuales de su grupo comunal, siempre ha demostrado su compromiso ante su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de una vaca de buena raza.
texts.en:
Antonia, 47, shares her life with her three children; they all live together in their own home. Since she was a little girl she was raised by her family who were farmers and cattlemen. This is how she learned all the secrets involved in corn, potato, pea and broad bean farming, among others. She also raises farm animals in her stables. This is her way of life. Her activities permit her to have the necessary income to meet her children’s needs. In addition, she sells milk that she gets from her cows and she sells the crops she grows. Sometimes her children help her and this way she keeps her family united. Her greatest wish is to increase her herd size especially with cows of a good breed that will produce higher quantities of milk. This is her 12th loan with MFP. She is one of the most active and punctual group members. She has always been committed to her group. She will use the requested funds to buy a cow of a good breed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tol buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a father of two, Alvin and Lillian. To earn a living, he does tailoring. He has been in this business for three years and has many customers because of his good reputation. He also does construction to earn more income for supporting his family. He joined Mapema group in Faulu Kenya to access financial resources. Through the group, he has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine. He hopes to expand his business for more income and to create employment. Gabriel describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Pasos Firme Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Pasos Firme 1, 2 & 3 (Firm steps). She makes her home here in a simple structure with a child. She says that her most difficult challenge has been the difficulties of living in poverty and in the past, she didn't have hope. Now all those things are changing.
 
Ana is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally those colmados are in the same neighborhood, a short walking distance from any home. She will use the profits to buy school supplies. In the future, she needs to buy a stove and building site. Her dream is that the Lord gives her strength to work and help her family. 

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, coffee, eggs, sugar, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, de 39 años, vive en su casa propia con 2 de sus tres hijos, pues el mayor ya es independiente.Es  una mujer muy trabajadora, que desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como: hamburguesas y salchipapas (platillo compuesto de salchichas y papas fritas acompañadas de salsas). Desde las 5 de la tarde coloca  un letrero afuera  de su casa para ofrecer estos ricos paltillos, pues ella misma los prepara y los vende en platos descartables a sus habituales clientes, quienes la buscan por su buen sabor y los buenos precios. El negocio progresa  y  por eso se siente contenta de brindarle  a sus hijos (quienes también la ayudan en el negocio) una buena calidad de vida. En el  futuro espera continuar  mejorando su negocio,  pues le gusta mucho y le brinda la comodidad de realizarlo en su casa.Es su diecisieteavo préstamo que tiene con MFP,  y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.Cristina tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios  ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de sus platillos, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old and lives in her own home with 2 of her 3 children, as the oldest is now on her own. She is a very hard-working woman that for the past several years has been selling fast food such as, hamburgers and salchipapas (a dish made with fried sausage and French fries served with salsa). At 5:00 in the afternoon she puts a sign outside her house advertising these delicious dishes. She prepares them and sells them herself on disposable plates to her regular customers who come to her because of her tasty food and good prices. Her business is growing and she is happy to be able to give her children (who also help her in the business) a better quality of life. In the future, she hopes to continue improving her business as she likes it a lot and it offers her the convenience of working from home. This is her seventeenth loan with MFP and she has always been very responsible with her payments. Cristina plans to buy the various ingredients that she needs for the preparation of her dishes with the money requested and in this manner, she hopes to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of her fast food dishes

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en: Mutua N. is 45 years old and married with three children.  He does cattle farming together with his wife.  He employs one person who feeds the cattle.  Mutua has been farming for twelve years and has improved his business through Mumbuni Wa Mundu Group under Faulu Kenya.  He previously took out a loan through the group which helped him to increase production.  He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a water pump, which will solve the challenge of transporting water for a long distance to the farm.  He hopes to educate his children to university level. He plans to explore new methods of farming to increase his production. He dreams of buying an extra piece of land for farming. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for supplying water to the farm

loans.name: Luz Felicidad

texts.es:
Luz de 44 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y montañas en construcción).  Ella vende joyería en bisutería, recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil y vendiendo a sus conocidos y amigos. 

Ella vende en un puesto de víveres arroz, bebidas y enlatados pero como necesitaba un ingreso adicional para mantener a sus hijos decidió vender joyería, poco a poco a podido tener un nuecero elevado de clientes. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta que llega uno de sus hijos y después vende la joyería hasta las 02h00pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar  bisutería como cadenas, anillos y enlatados para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere cambiar su negocio a oro sector por la delincuencia que hay.
texts.en:
Luz, 44, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a semi-urban zone with dirt roads and mountains under construction). She sells costume jewelry, travelling around the streets of Guayaquil and selling to her acquaintances and friends. Luz also has a grocery stand - rice, drinks and canned goods, but as she needed an additional source of income to maintain her children she decided to sell jewelry. Little by little she has been able to obtain a greater list of clients. She works from 6 in the morning until one of her children arrives and afterwards she sells jewelry until 2pm. With this loan she wants to buy more costume jewelry such as necklaces, chains and tinned goods for her business. In the future Luz wants to move her business to the gold sector because of the delinquency that exists.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necklaces, rings and canned goods

loans.name: La Union # 2 Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario La Union # 2 esta integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y vecinas de la comunidad de San Lorenzo, se han constituido como grupo para obtener un credito para sacar adelante sus negocios, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la joven Neyli Alexandra B. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Orlin Joset Sauceda Rodriguez quien se dedica a trabajar como enfermero del centro de salud de Langue,  el le apoya economicamnete
y  Neyli se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser: tacos, pastelitos, enchiladas, baleadas, refrescos.
el credito lo utilzara para comprar materiales para la fabricacion de sus golosinas.

la joven Belky Marisela N. Z. tiene 24 años de edad, tiene un hijo y se dedica a la venta de 
cosmeticos, tambien trabaja por la jornada de la noche en el hospital de San Lorenzo como enfermera, se dedica a la venta de lociones desde hace 01 año le va muy bien, vive con su esposo en casa de sus suegros.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos.

la sra. Fidelina C. A. tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y vive en su propia casa en la colonia
Morazan desde hace 21 años, no tiene quien dependa de ella sus hijos estan ya casados y viven en USA.
Fidelina se dedica  a la venta de ropa usada y nueva
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un fardo de ropa americana para surtir mas su negocio.
su sueño es poder ver a sus hijos algun dia.
texts.en:
"La Union # 2" Communal Bank is made up of three hardworking women who are neighbors in the community of San Lorenzo. They have formed a group to obtain a loan in order to move their businesses ahead. The different activities that they do are listed below: Neyli Alexandra B. is 23 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with Orlin Joset Sauceda Rodriguez, who works as a nurse at the Langue health center. He supports her financially, and Neyli works selling snacks like tacos, cakes, enchiladas, baleadas (tortillas filled with beans and other ingredients), and soft drinks. She will use the loan to buy materials to make her snacks. Belky Marisela N. Z. is 24 years old, has one son and sells cosmetics. She also works as a nurse on the night shift at the San Lorenzo hospital. She has sold lotions for a year, and it has gone very well for her. She lives with her husband in her in-laws' house. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics. Fidelina C. A. is 63 years old, is married, and has lived in her own house in the Morazan neighborhood for 21 years. She has no dependents; her children are married now and live in the USA. Fidelina sells new and used clothing. She will use the loan to buy a bundle of American clothing to stock her business. Her dream is to be able to see her children someday.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bundle of used clothing, Avon cosmetics, and ingredients for snacks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Hace 2 años, posee una granja, donde cría animales, entre ellos cuyes y pollos, negocio que emprendió por recomendación de sus padres, desde entonces se dedica en la alimentación y limpieza de su granja. Durante las mañanas sale a cortar alfalfa, que sirve de forraje para estos animales, después termina el día limpiando los galpones, donde extrae el excremento utilizándolo como abono para sus plantas. Al llegar el fin de semana, sale a vender sus animales, por tanto ha logrado adquirir buenas rentas. La meta que se ha propuesto es ampliar su granja. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra de más animales de raza, así como también en materiales para ampliar su galpón.
texts.en:
Betty is 20 years old. She lives in her parents' house. For 2 years, she has owned a farm where she raises animals, among them guinea pigs and chickens. She began this business on the recommendation of her parents and since then she has worked doing the feeding and cleaning at the farm. During the morning she goes out to cut alfalfa which serves as forrage for the animals. Afterwards, she ends the day by cleaning out the sheds, where she extracts the excrement, using it as fertilizer for her plants. When the weekend comes, she goes out to sell her animals, and in this way she has been able to obtain good profit. The goal that she has proposed is enlarging her farm. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support since she has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She also likes being part of a community group because all of the members are responsible and very supportive. She will use the laon she is asking for to buy more purebred animals, as well as materials to enlarge her shed.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy purebred animals and materials to enlarge her shed.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna, 29, is a resident of the town of Machakos, where she lives with her husband and two children. She has been operating a retail shop where she sells sweets, bread, sugar and sodas. She has been in the business for two years.  She has many customers and employs one person to assist her in running the business in case she goes out to get more stock. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to increase her stock. She dreams of building her own house in the future.

loans.use: To buy sweets, bread, sugar and sodas

loans.name: Hermen Abed

texts.es:
el señor Hermen Abed N. Zuniga tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos van al escuela. su esposa se llama Jessi Varinia Espinal quien es ama de casa. 
Hermen trabaja en su taller de carpinteria fabricando muebles como ser: comodas, chineros, puertas, roperos y todo lo relacionado con la carpinteria.
el credito lo va a utilizar para hacer el techo de la galera en donde tiene el taller ya que que se traslado a su propiedad y tuvo que construir de nuevo su local de trabajo, ya que en donde estaba anteriormente su negocio era alquilado. 
la construccion de la galera es para trabajar mejor, proteger sus obras del sol y del agua lluvia.
texts.en:
Hermen Abed N. Zuniga is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are at school. His wife, Jessi Varinia Espinal, looks after the home. Hermen works in his carpentry shop, where he makes furniture such as chests of drawers, cabinets, doors, wardrobes, and other carpentry items. Hi is going to use this loan to replace the roof of the out-building where he has his workshop. He owns it now, where previously he was renting the space, and he has to make some major improvements. Re-building the place will mean he can work better, protecting his pieces from the sun and rain.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Maria Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora María Lastenia es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui, esta parroquia es la mayor productora de leche ya que su gente en su mayor parte se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha emigrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.

Nuestra socia  tiene de 40 años de edad,  es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes se encuentran de 20, 18, 6 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable y solo labora cuando le contratan para alguna construcción ya que es maestro albañil, con el esfuerzo  conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, también a la cría de pollos, cuyes, chanchos y ganado los mismos que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad.

 La señora es nuestra socia hace dos ciclos y está  muy contenta con sus amigas del grupo,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para el potrero y así criar y tener alimento para su ganado, ya que su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Lastenia is a member of the Nueva Juventud community bank and lives near the parish of Tarqui. This parish produces large quantities of milk since the majority of the population works in agriculture and raising cattle. Much of the population has emigrated to various places around the world in search of a better quality of life for their families. Our partner is 40 years old, married with 3 children ages 20, 18 and 6. Her two older children work and help economically while her husband can't find steady work, but does so when he is hired as a master bricklayer. Their joint efforts have allowed them to build their own home. Maria takes care of the daily household chores as well as raising chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and cattle which she sells when the need arises. She has been our partner through two cycles and is very happy with her friends in the group. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer for the grazing field so she can feed her cattle properly since her goal is to keep growing the business.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizer

loans.name: Omar Abel

texts.es:
el sr. Omar Abel A. se dedica al comercio desde hace unos 8 años es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, todos menores.
Su esposa trabaja en la empacadora Ibermar, juntos aportan dinero para el sustento de su familia.
tienen su propia casa ubicada en la Caucara San Lorenzo, Valle.
el viaja a la frontera del Amatillo todos los dias a vender sus productos como ser: focos de mano, antenas para tv, baterias, rasuradoras desechables, sus ventas son en dolares y es por esta razon que el viaja largo a vender por que le pagan mejor su producto.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia, sus clientes son turistas, camioneros y transportistas.
texts.en:
Omar Abel A. has been in business for the past 8 years, is married with four young children. His wife worker in the Ibermar packing plant, and together they contribute economically to maintaining their family. They have their own home in Caucara San Lorenzo, Valle. He travels daily to the border at Amatillo to sell goods such as: flashlights, tv antennas, batteries and disposable razors. His sales are in dollars which is why he travels so far since he gets better prices for his goods. He will use his loan to buy more merchandise for his clients which are tourists, truckers and drivers.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flashlights, TV antennas, razors, toothpaste, motor oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene  45 años, vive a lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, cultiva principalmente maíz  de colores. Durante la etapa de recolección su esposo e hijos la ayudan en la labor, en ocasiones contrata a sus vecinas, para que la ayuden a seleccionar cuidadosamente cada mazorca para secarlos al sol y después  envasarlos. Una vez terminada este proceso llega a transportarlos a la ciudad capital, para su respectiva venta. Su producto es bien cotizado, ya que la calidad de su cosecha es buena y esto la anima a continuar adelante. Asimismo recibe buenas rentas que le ayuda a solventar los gastos familiares, pero cuando no tiene suficiente producción y la demanda aumenta, logra comprar de sus vecinos a fin de cumplir con la demanda del cliente. Tiene planes de incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, asegura ser responsable con sus pagos, además se siente muy satisfecha de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, porque le permite  socializar  con los demás integrantes de su grupo y compartir ideas de progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará terrenos ya sembrados de maíz, debido a la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children in her own home. She has worked in agriculture for more than 21 years, mainly cultivating colored corn. During the harvest season her husband and children help her with the work, and at times she also hires neighbors, so that they can help her carefully choose each ear of corn to dry in the sun, and later pack. Once this process is finished the corn is transported to the capital city for sale. Her products are highly sought-after, since the quality of her harvest is good, and this motivates her to continue with the business. Also, she receives good profits that help her to cover the household expenses. When there is not enough production and the demand increases, she manages to buy from her neighbors in order to meet the demands of her customers. She has plans to increase her production. This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she assures us that she will be responsible with her payments. In addition, she feels very pleased to belong to a communal bank, because this allows her to socialize with the other members of the group and share ideas about how to make progress with her business. With the loan she requests she will buy land that is already planted with corn, so that she can keep up with the demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy land that is already planted with corn to increase her production

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora. Maria L. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui, esta parroquia es la mayor productora de leche ya que su gente en su mayor parte se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha emigrado a varios lugares del mundo para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.

La Señora. Maria es nuestra socia hace dos ciclos y forma parte de un gran grupo de mujeres quienes buscan mejorar sus negocios, se dedica a la agricultura labrando  su propia tierra, también cría pollos los que vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 61 años de edad, es viuda hace 15 años y tiene 3 hijos de 36, 33 y 26 años de edad, su primer hijo está por casarse, y sus dos últimos hijos no viven en el país pero si le ayudan económicamente.

Nos comenta que su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y así crecer en su negocio, su meta es tener un criadero de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
Maria L. is a member of the Nueva Juventud community bank and lives in the parish of Tarqui. This parish produces great quantities of milk since most of the population works in agriculture and raising cattle. Much of the population has emigrated to various places around the world in order to provide a better quality of life for their families. Maria has been our partner through two cycles and is part of a wonderful group of women looking to improve their businesses. She makes a living farming her own land, as well as raising and selling chickens in the community. Our partner is 61, was widowed 15 years ago and has 3 children ages 36, 33 and 26. Her eldest son is about to get married and the other two live outside the country but help out economically. She tells us that she will invest her new loan in the purchase of more chickens to grow the business towards a goal of having a larger poultry farm.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens

loans.name: Nelson Yovany

texts.es:
el señor Nelson Yovany C. Argueta tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica a atender la casa, el viaja todos los dias en bus a El Salvador para  vender sus productos y asi poder traer el sustento diario a su familia, Nelson vende relojes, lentes, extenciones electricas, antenas para tvs, radios, baterias para focos de mano, etc.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia.
 
vive en casa de su mama con su esposa y sus dos hijos.
 
su deseo es hacer su propia casa.
texts.en:
Nelson Yovany C. Argueta is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. His wife takes care of the house, and he travels each day on a bus to El Salvador to sell his products, since this is the way that he supports his family. Nelson sells watches, sunglasses, electrical extension cords, TV and radio antennas, flashlight batteries, etc. He will use this loan to buy merchandise. He lives in his mother's house with his wife and their 2 children. His wish is to build his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy watches, toothpaste, sunglasses, electrical extension cords, TV and radio antennas, and flashlight batteries

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 58 años, vive en su casa propia, con 2 de sus 4 hijos, pues lo mayores tienen sus propias familias y son independientes.Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de productos naturales en su  puesto ubicado en el mercado de la zona por donde vive, y por el  tiempo que tiene en este negocio tiene muchos clientes que la visitan frecuentemente. Su trabajo empieza desde muy temprano, todos los días, y se extiende hasta las 5 de la tarde. Aunque su negocio  la tiene muy satisfecha, lo que le disgusta son las largas horas que tiene que permanecer bajo los rayos del sol en el mercado; pero no se desanima y continúa trabajando duro. A pesar de que hace algunos años, enfrento una dura prueba, pues  su puesto se quemo y el hecho le causo algunas heridas, siente que tiene mucho por delante. Para el futuro tiene pensado mejorar su puesto para implementarlo mejor y además quiere renovar las maderas de su puesto, para presentar una mejor imagen ante su clientela.Es el onceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y siempre ha sido muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, porque tiene muchas ganas de continuar progresando.Julia tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra  de mayor cantidad de productos naturales, con lo cual espera obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Julia, 58, lives in her own home with two of her four children because the oldest ones have their own families and are independent. For the past 15 years she has sold natural products in a sales stall she has in one of the markets near her home. Because of the long time she has been in business, she has quite a few regular customers that visit her frequently. She is open for business daily from very early in the morning until 5pm. Although her work is very satisfying what she dislikes about it is spending long hours under the relentless sun in the market. However, she doesn’t become discouraged and continues to work hard. Despite facing quite a hardship a few years ago when her stall burned down and she was injured in the fire she feels she still has much to look forward to. For the future, she plans to improve her stall both by stocking it better and by replacing the lumber in it in order to improve its appearance and make it more appealing to her customers. This is her 11th loan with MFP. She has always repaid on time because she wants to continue to make progress. Julia plans to use the funds to buy larger amounts of natural products hoping thereby to obtain increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
el sr. Edilberto R. F. tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, tiene casa propia y radica en la Criba San Lorenzo, Valle.
 
el se dedica desde hace 05 años a la compra venta de achineria, negocio con el cual mantiene economicamente a su familia, todo los dias viaja en autobus a El Salvador a vender su mercaderia.
 las ventas son mejores en ese lugar porque pagan en dolares, le va muy bien.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia
su deseo es que las cosas se mejoren para la economia del pais.
texts.en:
Edilberto R. F., 38, lives with his wife and two children in his own home located in Criba San Lorenzo, Valle. For the last 5 years he has been a vendor of general merchandise. This business supports his family. He takes the bus daily to El Salvador to sell his merchandise. Sales are better there because payments are in dollars and he does well. He will use the funds to buy merchandise. His wish is that his country’s economy improves.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flashlights, shavers, batteries, remote controls, eyeglasses, watches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María M. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la parroquia de Quingeo, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos verdes y su vegetación en su estado natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha emigrado a varios lugares del mundo para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos quienes se encuentran de 26, 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, 12 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija es separada de su esposo y ahora vive en su casa de su madre ayudándole en su trabajo, su segunda hija es especial, su tercera hija es casada y vive de manera independiente, su cuarto y quinto hijo trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, su sexto hijo pasa en la casa ayudándole en los quehaceres del hogar y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela, con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa pero es muy pequeña para su gran familia, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de cuyes y también a la agricultura labrando su propia tierra.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y los créditos anteriores le han beneficiado para la compra de cuyes, ahora  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para  mejorar el potrero y así tener alimento para sus cuyes, su meta es  seguir creciendo en el criadero de  cuyes.
texts.en:
María M. is a member of the Nueva Juventud (New Youth) communal bank. She lives in Quingeo parish. This parish is noted for its green pastures and vegetation in its natural state. Its inhabitants are mostly farmers. Much of the population has emigrated to various parts of the world to provide their families with better quality of life. She is 49 years old, married and has 8 children who are 26, 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, 12 and 8 years of age. Her oldest daughter is separated from her husband and now lives with her mother and helps her with her work. Her second daughter has special needs. Her third is married and lives independently. Her fourth and fifth sons are employed and help her out financially. Her sixth son stays home and helps her with her household chores and her youngest two are still in school. With her work she has managed to build her house but it’s too small for such a large family. Her husband is a farmer. She raises guinea pigs and also farms her own farmlands. This is her 3rd loan cycle. She used her previous loans to buy guinea pigs. She will use this new loan to buy manure to improve her field in order to have feed for her guinea pigs. Her goals are to continue growing as a guinea pig producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Opal Amparo

texts.es:
la joven Opal Amparo Salazar tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres en la casa de un tio. 
Opal se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, tambien vende zapatos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, en los ratos que ella no esta en su negocio lo atiende su mama, ya que Opal tambien estudia en la universidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de dos fardos de ropa.
nos comento que se encuentra muy feliz ya que le estan saliendo bien ls cosas con su negocio y que desea ampliarlo en un futuro.
mas su sueño en lo personal es tener su titulo como doctora en medicina.
texts.en:
Opal Amparo Salazar is a 24 year old young woman. She is single, and she lives with her parents in her uncle’s house. Opal sells clothes for women and men. She also sells shoes. She has been doing this for five years. During the times she is not at her business her mother tends to it. Opal also attends the university. She will use the loan to buy bundles of clothes. She says that she is very happy because things are going well for her in her business. She wishes to expand it in the future. Her personal dream is to have her degree as a doctor of medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Gloria Soledad

texts.es:
la señora Gloria Soledad S. tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda, su profesion es maestra pero ya esta jubilada.
ahora se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de flores artificiales para toda ocacion. 
tiene casa propia y negocio propio y vive con sus dos hijos.
esta actividad la realiza desde hace 11 años despues de que ella se jubila se dedico a este negocio para mantenerse ocupada y cubrir con los gastos de la casa.

el credito lo utilizara para compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de sus arreglos.
Gloria tambien fabrica piñatas y coronas.
todos los dias le pide a Dios que uno de sus hijos deje de ingerir bebidas alcoholicas ya que le da muchos problemas.
texts.en:
Gloria Soledad S., 64, is a widow. She is a teacher by profession but she’s now retired. She currently manufactures artificial flower arrangements for all occasions. She owns her own home and her business and she lives with her two children. Since she retired 11 years ago, she has been in this line of work in order to stay busy and meet household expenses. She will use the funds to buy raw materials for her flower arrangements. Gloria also makes piñatas (Jar or pot ornamented with fancy paper and filled with sweetmeats, which is hung from the ceiling so that the merrymakers, one by one and blindfolded, try to break it with a stick) and funeral wreaths. Every day she prays to God that one of her sons stops drinking alcoholic beverages because this causes many problems for her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic flowers, glue, thread, leaves, flower pots.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El szeñor Francisco M. M., tiene la edad de 52 años, es casado y su esposa le apoya en los gastos del hogar laborando como comerciante de ropa y calzado, ellos se dedican desde hace 10 años a esta actividad y a sido su fuente de ingresos y el sustento diario de su familia.

Actualmente habitan en humilde hogar, y con el esfuerzo de su pareja y él, han construido su nuevo hogar y en este mes realizaron las levatamiento de paredes y solicitan un prestamo terminar este proceso y avanzazr en gran medida las remodelaciones, esta inversion le permitira ofrecerle a su familia una vivienda mas optima y digna para su mejor desarrollo socio economico.
texts.en:
Francisco M. M., 52, is married. His wife contributes to household expenses working as a clothing and shoe merchant. They have been in this line of work for 10 years and it’s been the source of income and support for the family. They currently live in a humble abode. With help from his wife they have built a new home and this month they raised the walls. They are requesting a loan to finish this project and to move forward with the home improvements. This investment will provide the family with a much more appropriate and proper home for their socio-economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 33 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos en su casa que es  propia.Luego de 7 años de experiencia que tiene en la atención de su tienda, ha logrado sacar adelante el negocio, y con el paso del tiempo ha crecido y ha podido comprar algunos artículos para el hogar y de esta manera logro  instalar  un bien abastecido bazar. En la actualidad no solo vende comestibles, si no que también ha colocado nuevos estantes donde ofrece  peluches, joyas, adornos y muchos otros objetos  necesarios para el hogar. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes que frecuentemente le  compran sus productos, pero le disgusta tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de la tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, pues quiere  brindarles mayor comodidad a sus habituales clientes.Es el diecisieteavo préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Liz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de adornos para fiestas patrias peruanas (como escarapelas, insignias, banderas) que ya se acercan, y  siente que obtendrá muy buenas ganancias que le permitirán continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Liz, age 33, lives with her life partner and their children in her own house. After having seven years of experience tending her store, she has gotten ahead in the business. With the passage of time it has grown. She has been able to buy some items for the home, and she has set up a well stocked bazaar. She now not only sells food, but she has also put in some new shelves where she sells stuffed animals, jewelry, decorations, and many other objects that are needed for the home. She enjoys talking with her customers who come in frequently to buy her products. But, she does not like having to stay all day inside the store without being able to leave. In time she wants to improve the store’s facilities. She wants to provide greater comfort to her regular customers. This is her 17th loan with MFP. She has always been characterized as being very punctual with all her repayments. Liz plans to invest the requested money in buying decorations for the Peruvian National Holidays (such as ribbons, insignias, and flags) that are approaching. She feels that she will get very good earnings, which will allow her to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Fátima es una mujer trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, desde hace varios años vende frutas y verduras, también ha comenzado a vender ropa interior de dama, sandalias de hule para baño, y productos de ofertas que encuentra en el mercado que vende a mejor precio.

Su esposo tiene un taller de pintura y enderezado, con sus crédito anterior ha hecho mejoras  a su casa. Pero con este crédito desea mejorar el pequeño taller para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que parte de las ganancias del taller son para los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos y otros.
Con estas mejoras pretende captar clientes nuevos, para esto comprara: tres quintales de hierro, doscientos bloques, arena, estribos, cemento para terminar de cerrar toda de concreto.
Contenta por a través de estos préstamo ha logrado una mejor comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is a hard working woman and the mother of two children. For several years now she has sold fruits and vegetables. She has also started to sell women’s underwear, rubber bathroom sandals and other articles that she buys on sale in the market and resells at higher prices. Her husband has a car paint and body shop. She used previous loans to make home improvements but will use this loan to make improvements on the small workshop in order to provide better customer service since part of the profits from the shop are used to pay for her children’s education and other expenses. With these improvements she plans to attract new customers. To accomplish this she plans to buy: three quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of iron, two-hundred cinder blocks, sand, buttresses and cement to finish enclosing it with concrete. She is happy that she has managed to increase her entire family’s comfort level through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María de  43 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde su niñez borda creativos diseños  sobre  faldas típicas de la  región donde vive.  Su labor  la realiza diariamente en su casa, y durante los fines de semana comercializa sus bordados en el  mercado local de su zona, sus principales clientes son los comerciantes de trajes típicos, es por eso que cada día tiene que  avanzar regularmente para producir sus bordados en mayor cantidad. Para ella es clave tener siempre disponible sus materiales, porque así puede avanzar sin problemas. Paralelamente a esta actividad  también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos que engorda y después de 3 meses vende en el mercado de su zona. Afirma que le gusta trabajar más en los bordados, porque no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, pero si de mucha creatividad además considera  que su trabajo no tiene pierde, porque los bordados no son perecibles, como los alimentos. Ahora aprovechara la época de  festividades de su zona, pues tiene mayor cantidad de pedidos.Es la oportunidad numero 11 que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo solicitado ya que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.María invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  materiales como hilos y telas, de diferentes colores y variedades, que necesita para sus bordados, ya que sabe que debe aprovechar estas épocas, pues obtendrá mayores pedidos.
texts.en:
María, 43, lives in her own home with her two children. Since her childhood she has embroidered creative designs on skirts that are typical of the area where she lives. She works daily at home and on the weekends she sells her works of embroidery at the local markets in her area. Her main customers are merchants who sell typical costumes and this is why she must advance daily with her production in order to produce higher quantities of items. For her, having supplies on hand is key because then she can advance problem free. Alongside this activity, she also raises pigs which she sells in her area markets after three months of fattening. She states that she enjoys the embroidery work more because it doesn’t require much physical exertion. In addition, she feels that this work doesn’t have any loss because the items aren’t perishable like food. She is taking advantage of the festive season in her area because orders are increased. This is her 11th opportunity with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help because she has always been responsible with her repayments. Additionally, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and support each other. Also, she is grateful to all the people that made the loan possible because it will be very useful for her business’s progress. María will use the funds to buy raw materials like thread and fabric in assorted colors and varieties that she needs for her embroidery because she is aware that she must capitalize on this season when orders increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en: Charina A. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 26 years old. Charina is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Charina operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Charina has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Charina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Charina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Charina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bless

texts.en:
Bless T. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao. She is 40 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Bless owns and operates a general store, selling dry goods in the local community. Bless has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month from it.

In 2005, Bless joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bless has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Bless is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Bless from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia O. is from the village of Madalag, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years old, married and has 10 adult-aged children. Cresencia owns and operates a business selling fish. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for 29 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Cresencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Cresencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

location.town: Madalag, Jose Dalan Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda C. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Criselda owns and operates a food stall, primarily selling  cultured oyster products known as "talaba" in the local community. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Criselda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Criselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Criselda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from it.

Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah C. is from Lower Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is 39 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Hannah owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Hannah is just starting this business.

In 2008, Hannah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hannah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hannah is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Hannah from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda D. is from the village of Nipaan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Hilda owns a fishing business. Hilda has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Hilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional materials for her business. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Hilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials for fishing

loans.name: Annaliza

loans.name: Marie Dolly Campos' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Marie Dolly C., who is 47 years of age and married, is a resident of P2 Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  Marie Dolly is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marie Dolly C.’ Group.

Marie Dolly is blessed with four children, two of whom are married while the other two are teenagers and presently studying in high school.  For their living, she decided to engage in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business and in selling barbeque sticks. She is supported by her husband, Marcial, who is a farmer.  For 25 years she has maintained her business activities and at this time she is earning an average net income of not less than $90 a month, which is so helpful to their family income.

Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, awarded for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines (during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006), she joined the cooperative this year, 2010. 

As a newly recognized member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out the rural poor, Marie Dolly is requesting an amount of 4,000 PHP for her first loan, to be used as additional capital for her businesses. 

The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions of her family, to meet their basic needs, to make loan repayments to PMPC, to pay for her children’s education and for possible business expansion.

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
