loans.name: Tlacpacame Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama tlacpacame, que significa “L. D. arriba”  en náhuatl, su lengua nativa. Está ubicado en el Estado D. Puebla en México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes.
Josefina G.M. presidenta del grupo. Tiene 49 años, no tiene estudios, casada, comerciante y tiene en total 9 hijos: 5 mujeres y 4 varones D. L. cuales solo 3 son menores D. edad y dependen D. ella económicamente.  Ella se dedica a la compra venta D. ajos, negocio que inició hace más D. 15 años ya que la comunidad a la pertenece se identifica como gran productora D. ajo a nivel nacional, incluso se pueD. percibir en ocasiones su olor con tan sólo ir caminando por sus calles. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ajo D. mayoreo y poder obtener un buen precio que le permita una mayor ganancia. Sus clientes opinan que el producto que ofrece es D. calidad y muy limpio. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente  contenta. A futuro desea comprar en mayores volúmenes. También espera darles a sus hijos la oportunidad D. estudiar para que tengan una mejor calidad D. vida, ya que ella no tuvo oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela. 
L. otros integrantes del grupo son:
1. María D. Jesús A.V 			Venta D. ropa típica
2. Juana T.F 				Venta D. ajo
3. María Frida P.P 			Venta D. artícuL. D. curación y D. farmacia
4. Gregoria Magdalena S.G  		Venta D. verduras
5. Hortencia Feliciana M.R 		Venta D. ajos en tianguis
6. Alma Rosa M. F. 			Venta D. productos lácteos
7. Graciela Roberta T.S  		Venta D. ropa típica
8. Elia Teresa G.M 			Venta D. ropa típica
9. Martha Hilda P. B 			Venta D. especies en tianguis
texts.en:
This group, consisting of 10 members, is called Tlacpacame which means “Those on Top” in Náhuatl, their native tongue. It is located in the Mexican state of Puebla. Josefina G.M., 49, is group president. She has never gone to school, is married, is a merchant and has 9 children, 5 girls and 4 boys, of which three are still minors economically dependent on her. She is a garlic merchant. She started her business over 15 years ago since the community she belongs to is known nationally as a great garlic producer. In fact, you can perceive the aroma of garlic merely by walking along its streets. She is asking for funds to buy garlic at wholesale at a good price that will allow her to make better profits. Her customers are of the opinion that the product she offers is of high quality and very clean. At the time of requesting the loan she feels happy. She hopes in the future to buy larger amounts. She also hopes to proviD. her children with the opportunity to study so that they can have a better quality of life since she did not have the opportunity to go to school. The other group members are: 1. María D. Jesús A.V Typical clothing sales 2. Juana T.F Garlic sales 3. María Frida P.P Pharmacy and sale of curative items 4. Gregoria Magdalena S.G Vegetable sales 5. Hortencia Feliciana M.R Garlic sales at open-air markets 6. Alma Rosa M. F. Dairy products sales 7. Graciela Roberta T.S Typical clothing sales 8. Elia Teresa G.M Typical clothing sales 9. Martha Hilda P. B Spice sales at open-air markets

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy garlic at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure two dairy cows.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel operates a mixed farm on the outskirts of Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for twenty years and employs two farmhands. He produces milk, bananas, maize, beans, tree seedlings and tea which he sells locally and to the Kenya Tea Development Authority, respectively.

Samuel is 42 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 18. All the children attend school.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to provide enough milk for his family and to pay school fees with the income from the milk sales. He plans to buy a bull for his dairy cows to avoid the high cost and risk of artificial insemination.

His primary challenge has been the lack of enough money to buy animal feeds and to treat the animals when they fall sick. He appreciates the help given by Juhudi.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is 63 years old. He is married with 8 adult children. He has been farming for 20 years in Kisii town in Western Kenya. Simion's products are tea, milk and trees, which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market.

Simion recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo.  He has requested this loan of KES 40,000 to purchase farm supplies to plant tea and coffee and to buy a dairy cow. He believes that through this investment, he will earn income from the sale of milk and tea and the health of his family will improve.

He has been challenged by crop and animal diseases, which affect his income.

In the future, Simion would like to improve his farming techniques and expand his farm to take advantage of economies of scale. He appreciates the financial help that has improved the lives of his family members.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old. He is married with 7 children aged between 5 and 27. Five of the children attend school.

He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been farming for the last 20 years and employs 2 people from his community. His products are milk, tea, maize and beans which he sells locally. He also owns and operates a small restaurant in the same area (pictured above).

Peter has requested this loan of KES.30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will increase his capital base and that the profits from the sale of milk will enable him to send his children to better schools.

In future, he hopes to put up a big retail shop, a salon and kinyozi (barber shop). However, Peter says he faces the challenge of natural disasters and lack of enough farm input for production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence operates a mixed farm in Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 15 years and employs one farmhand. His main products are milk, tea, bananas and chicken, which he sells locally. Lawrence is also a mason. He is 44 years old and married with six children between the ages of 6 and 22. All his children except one attend school.

Lawrence recently paid off a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to lease land and plant napier grass for his three dairy cows. He says that this loan will increase his income through the sale of milk, improve his family's health, and produce enough manure for his farm from his cows. However, he faces the challenge of livestock diseases and lack of a market for his milk. In five years' time, he plans to increase his herd of cows to at least seven. He appreciates the help and would like to be financed again in the future.

loans.use: To lease land and plant napier grass for his dairy cows

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a dedicated member and chairman of Thoth Ber Self Help Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from Kisii town, in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 38 years and produces kales (a type of cabbage), maize, groundnuts and beans, which he sells to schools and the local market.

Michael is 63 years old. He is married and has 6 children who are all adults. Apart from farming, he is also employed by Kenya Lake Field.
He has requested this loan, from Juhudi Kilimo, of KES 45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will increase the family's income hence improve their lifestyle. He believes that with hard work and more financial help he will expand his business and increase his income.

He is grateful to Juhudi for the loan that he has been given.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Mykolai

texts.en:
Mykolai is divorced and is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, western Ukraine.

Mykolai owns a cafeteria in his home town which he opened only a year ago. He has already invested 10,000 Grivnyas in this business. Currently, he is making 5,000 Grivnyas of net profit each month. He realizes his cafeteria has to offer friendly customer service to earn a good reputation in the community.

Mykolai is seeking a loan of 3,800 Grivnyas to remodel his cafeteria. He wants to expand the floor space and make the cafeteria a more comfortable and welcoming place for potential customers. He is hoping to achieve that goal, attract new clients and increase his income as a result.

loans.use: To remodel his cafeteria and increase its floor space

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is married with a teenage son. She owns a clothing sales business in the central marketplace of her home town of Beregovo. She started this small venture five years ago and presently has 12,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 4,000 - 5,000 Grivnyas a month.

Silviya is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to re-stock her seasonal merchandise. She is seeking to keep a nice selection of good-quality clothing at affordable prices in her vending kiosk.

Silviya has proved to be reliable with all her previous loans, having repaid them without any delinquencies. Her family is very supportive and helpful in all her business endeavors.

loans.use: To re-stock her seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married and is a small-business owner in Stryi. He sells a variety of computer hardware and offers computer-related maintenance services. His business is well-known for quality at reasonable prices. He has been running his business for two years and presently has 55,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His net profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month.

Roman is seeking a loan of 8,400 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise, i.e. computer accessories and components (processor units, memory modules, cartridges, etc.) and thus attract potential clientele.

Since computers have become an integral part of basically every Ukrainian home, this type of inventory always remains in high demand, which benefits Roman's business. He is hoping to see his venture grow and expand even further in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Bokk Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de Solidarité BOKK DIOM est créé le 14 décembre 2008 au sortir de la formation du comité de gestion du Banc Villageois de SERAS1 dont ledit groupe de solidarité fait partie. Il est composé de 08 femmes issues toutes du même quartier et partagent les mêmes idées de solidarité, de fraternité et d'entre-aide. C'est un groupe plus ou moins homogène, les femmes sont âgées en moyenne de 45 ans et mères d'au moins de 3 enfants. Elles mènes des activités communes pendant plusieurs années telles les tontines, des rencontres périodiques etc. Et lors des fêtes religieuses elles s'habillent de la même sorte avec un tissus de même motif et même couleur, ce qui témoigne l'entente qui règne au niveau du groupe de solidarité. Le groupe de solidarité s'active au tour de l'embouche ovine et bovine, la vente de bois de chauffe etc. Ce nouveau crédit leur permettra de renforcer ces activités énumérées. 

Rokhaya F., en premier plan à droit de la photo avec une écharpe au cou et en médaillon en bas au milieu de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle à 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge et tutrice de 03 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, son présent prêt lui servir& à acheter un bœuf et des produits véto pour l'emboucher et le revendre au bout de 5 mois. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la gestion financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The BOKK DIOM solidarity group has been created on December 2008, following the creation of the Management Committee of the Banc Villageois of SERAS1, to which this solidarity group belongs. The group is composed of eight women all living in the same neighborhood and sharing the spirit of solidarity, sisterhood and mutual help. This group is more or less homogenous: the women are on the average 45 years old and have at least three children. For several years, they have been engaged in many communal activities, such as savings network, regular meetings etc. And during religious holidays they dress in the same style, choosing fabrics of the same color and pattern, to demonstrate unity among the group members. Their line of business is raising sheep and cattle, selling firewood etc. This new loan will allow them to strengthen their business activities. Rokhaya F., in the first row to the right, wearing a scarf around her neck and a pendant (her individual photo also appears in the middle on the bottom of the group photo) is the group leader. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of six children; she also has three other children in her charge, entrusted to her by their parents. She raises cattle; this loan will allow her to purchase a calf and the necessary foods in order to fatten and resell it five month later. Her goal is to help her husband with the family budget.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening  business activities of the solidarity group

loans.name: Fass Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité FASS DIOM est créé le 14 décembre 2008 suite à la formation du comité de gestion du Banc Villageois de SERAS1 qui abrite ledit groupe de solidarité. Il est composé de 08 femmes issues du même quartier et développent toutes un esprit de solidarité, de partage et d'entre-aide. Au sein du groupe se tiennent régulièrement des rencontre de concertation et/ou de sensibilisation, des tontines, des visites entre les membres etc. C'est un groupe très dynamique et s'active en général au tour du petit commerce, de la teinture et de la restauration. Et ce nouveau crédit va contribuer au renforcement a ces-dites activités. Le groupe en sus des remboursements réguliers que ses membres font, rembourse solidairement ses crédits sans difficultés.

Madame Marème F., en deuxième position, debout à partir de la gauche sur la photo avec une écharpe rose parsemée de points blancs et un foulard bleu sur la tête, (elle est mise en médaillon en haut à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge, elle est aussi tutrice d'un enfants qui lui est confié par des proches. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et son crédit servira à acheter un bœuf qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 5 mois. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille à l'occurrence pour la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The FASS DIOM solidarity group was formed on December 14, 2008 following the creation of the management committee for the Banc Villageois of SERAS1, home to the solidarity group. It consists of eight women from the same neighborhood, united in a spirit of solidarity, sharing and mutual assistance. The group regularly holds consultation and/or awareness meetings, tontines, visits between members, etc. It is a very dynamic group engaged, for the most part, in small-scale commerce, dyeing and food services. The new loan will help strengthen these activities. Along with regular repayments by its members, the loans are reimbursed jointly by the group without any difficulty. Mrs. Mareme F. is the head of the solidarity group. In the photo, she is standing second from left, wrapped in a pink shawl with white dots and wearing a blue scarf on her head (shown in the inset at the top right). She is 50-years old, married and the mother of four children in her care. She is also the guardian of another child entrusted to her by relatives. She has a beef fattening activity, and she plans to use her credit to buy an ox, fatten it up and resell it at the end of a 5-month period. She is contributing to the improvement of her family’s living conditions, namely with food and healthcare.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote the commercial activities of the solidarity group

loans.name: Begg Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BEGG DIAM est composé de (6) femmes issues du même quartier. Le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14/12/2008 au sortir de la formation du comité de gestion du Banc Villageois de SERAS1 qui abrite ledit Groupe de solidarité. Elles ont eu à mener beaucoup d'activités ensemble, elles font des tontines, des rencontres périodiques de sensibilisation et d'information etc.  l'activité principale dans ce groupe c'est le petit commerce de légumes, des habits et de fruits de saison (pastèques, mangues, oranges, mandarines). Ce prêt leur permettra a financer ses activités ci-dessus. 

Madame NDEYE G., debout en deuxième position à partir de la droite sur la photo avec une écharpe verte claire sur la tête (et mise en évidence dans un médaillon en bas de la photo tout à fait à droite) est la présidente du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et a aussi la charge de ses 07 petits fils et petits filles. Elle fait du petit commerce, elle vend des pagnes, de l'encens et des colliers en perles. Son présent crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa marchandise. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The BEGG DIAM solidarity group is composed of 6 women from the same district. The solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008 at the end of the training by the management committee of the “Banc Villageois” of SERAS1, home to the said solidarity group. They have had to run many activities together. They hold tontines, recurring awareness and information meetings etc. This group’s main activity is the small-scale trade of vegetables, clothes and seasonal fruits (watermelons, mangos, oranges, tangerines). This loan will enable them to finance the activities above. Mrs. NDEYE G., standing second from right on the photo with a light green scarf on her head (shown in the inset at the bottom right of the photo) is the solidarity group’s president. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She is also in charge of her 7 grandsons and granddaughters. She runs a small-scale business. She sells loincloths, incense and pearl necklaces. Her current loan will enable her to build up her stock of goods. She supports her husband in providing for the family’s needs such as healthcare and food.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The financing of the solidarity group's business activities

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: Ramatoulaye Baldé est une femme de 42 ans, elle mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01 juin 2007 et a été 06 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit a a toujours remboursé sans problème. Elle fait de la restauration en vendant chaque matin le petit déjeuné sur une table de fortune qu'elle a installé dans son village. Ce prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en denrées et mieux développer son activité. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye Baldé is 44. She is married and has four children, all still at home. She has belonged to the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007, and has had six loans from it, all repaid in full and on time. Every morning she fixes and sells breakfast from a table in her village. This loan will enable her to build inventory and grow her business. Her profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions, for example their nutrition and health.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Florecita Group

texts.es:
Doña Catarina H. G., es una persona casada, tiene 5 hijos, es una persona  trabajadora, y a pesar de su extrema pobreza ha salido adelante en se desempeña en la  venta de bananos y también en la elaboración de choco bananos, vende en la  aldea de Chivarreto en la escuela de paraje Chipotrer, de la aldea mencionada  es una persona entusiasta a pesar de su poca escoralidad, es  alguien que tambien le ha sacado provecho a la actividad de  crianza de animales,  su punto de venta  de estos animales, es en la plaza del municipio de San Francisco el Alto, del departamento  de  Totonicapán, ella  necesita ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la crianza de animales, ha decidido formar un grupo con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias. 

Este grupo de señoras son del paraje Pasaquiquim, de la aldea San Sija, del municipio de San Francisco el Alto,  del departamento de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Catarina H. G. is married and has 5 children. She is a hard-working person who, despite her extreme poverty, has gotten ahead. She is a banana merchant and she also makes and sells chocobananos (chocolate covered bananas) in the village of Chivarreto at Chipotrer school. Despite her meager schooling she’s an enthusiastic person who has also learned how to benefit from raising animals for sale. She sells the animals in San Francisco el Alto’s plaza in the department of Totonicapán. She needs to increase the number of animals she raises and has decided to join a group in order to request a loan to finance her economic activity thereby improving her own and her family’s living conditions. This group of women is from Pasaquiquim settlement, part of San Sija village, San Francisco el Alto municipality, Totonicapán department.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals.

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma S. est une femme de 63, elle est veuve et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a été 06 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. La réception de son crédit coïncide avec la tombée de l'hivernage et ça lui permettra d'acheter des semences d'arachide et de mil et de l'engrais pour faire une bonne campagne hivernale. Les récoltes lui permettront de vivre et faire des reserves et quand une partie sera vendu ça lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins familiaux
texts.en:
Diouma S. is a 63 year old woman. She is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of KANDIA's "Banc Villageois" since June 1, 2007. She has benefited from 6 consecutive loans and has never had a problem repaying. The loan received coincides with the arrival of the rainy season. It will allow her to purchase peanut seeds, millet seeds and fertilizer to achieve a good winter campaign. The harvest will enable her to save and will allow her to provide for her family's needs once part of the harvest will be sold.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gaston

texts.es: El señor Gastón se dedica a la venta de repuestos de tornería, vive en casa de su esposa con sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el señor esta feliz del Crédito con tasa preferencial kiva,  el Señor  reparte repuestos en motocicleta que le ayuda bastante a reducir los gastos de transporte, reparte por todas las zonas de  la ciudad,  en si recorre toda Cochabamba, esta feliz con kiva por que le ayudo bastante en el negocio que tiene,  es una persona trabajadora que empezó desde muy pequeño con el negocio, el destino del crédito es para poder comprar mas insumos de tornería que ya es muy conocido en el ámbito.
texts.en:
Gastón dedicates himself to the sale of lathing supplies. He lives in his wife's house with his school-aged children. He is happy about Kiva's preferential rate loan. He distributes supplies by motorcycle and that greatly helps reducing transportation costs. He distributes supplies all around town and travels all over Cochabamba. He is happy with Kiva for greatly helping him with his business. He is a hardworking person who started his business really young. The goal of this loan is to purchase more lathing supplies since he is already very well known in his field.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lathing supplies

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou S. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 6 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle vend du carburant et des lubrifiants dans son village. Le village est très distant de la ville et on y note inexistence de station à essence alors le principal moyen de locomotion de la population est la moto. Elle tire profit de cette situation pour développer un petit commerce de carburant et de lubrifiants, ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer cette activité en achetant par quantité plus nombreuse. Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Aïssatou S. is a 34-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KANDIA since June 1, 2007 and has had six successive loans, which she has always repaid without a problem.  She sells fuel and lubricants in her village.  The village is far from the city, and people notice the lack of a gas station, while the principal means of transportation is the motorbike.  Aïssatou is deriving a profit from this situation in order to develop a small business for fuels and lubricants.  This loan will enable her to bolster this business through buying in greater quantities.  Her goal is to help to improve the family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Doing business in fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: Diénaba B. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a reçu 06 fois de suite de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de riz, d'huile végétale, de sucre, de thé etc.. et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'escompter de bénéfices plus intéressant. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Diénaba B. is 42. She is married with three children. She has belonged to the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007, and has had six loans that she had no problem repaying. She has a small business selling rice, vegetable oil, sugar, tea and so on. Her new loan will allow her to build her inventory so as to make more profit. Her goals are to help improve her family's standard of living and save more.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build working capital

loans.name: Paraje Centro Group

texts.es: La señora Santos Elías P.  tiene  8 hijos, es una persona  trabajadora, y a ha salido adelante, desempeñandose en  la  crianza de animales tales  como ganado porcino,   ella es una persona entusiasta a pesar de su poca escoralidad, es  alguien que le ha sacado provecho a la crianza de animales,  y lograr incrementar su negocio de crianza de animales  y lograr apoyar a su esposo en el gasto de la familia,  su punto de venta  de estos animales, es en el municipio de Momostenango, Totonicapán . Ella necesita ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la crianza de animales, por lo que decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un credito para financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia,  y apoyar en el crecimiento de la economía del país. Este es un grupo de señoras son del Paraje Centro,  de la Aldea  San Antonio Pasajoc , del municipio de Momostenango, departamento de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Santos Elías P. has 8 children. She is a hard working person and has gotten ahead raising pigs. She is an enthusiastic person despite her meager schooling. Raising animals has allowed her to get ahead and help her husband meet household expenses. She sells her animals in the Momostenango municipality in Totonicapán. She needs to increase the number of animals she raises so she has decided to organize a group to request a loan to finance her economic activity thereby improving her own and her family’s living conditions as well as support the country’s economy. This group of women is from Paraje Centro, San Antonio Pasajoc village, Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán department.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou S. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est veuve et vis avec ses deux enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 06 fois de suite reçu de crédit qu'elle a bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle développe un petit restaurant dans son village où elle sert régulièrement les repas du jour. Son prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en denrées afin de développer son activité de restauration et de fidéliser sa clientèle. Son objectif est de répondre aux besoins de santé, de nourriture, de vêtement de sa progéniture et pouvoir se prendre en charge tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Aïssatou S. is a 51 year old widow with two children. She is a member of the Village Bank of KANDIA since June 1, 2007 and has since borrowed six times, and with good management has repaid on time. She is developing a small restaurant in her village where it serves daily meals. The loan will allow her to better supply food products in order to develop the restaurant activity and retain customer loyalty. Her objective is to meet the needs for health, food, clothing of her offspring all the while maintaining her level of savings.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Diénabou

texts.fr: Diénabou S. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 06 fois de suite bénéficié de prêt et a toujours fidèlement remboursé. Elle vend du carburant et des lubrifiants dans son village. Le village est très distant de la ville et on y note inexistence de station à essence alors le principal moyen de locomotion de la population est la moto. Elle tire profit de cette situation pour développer un petit commerce de carburant et de lubrifiants, ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer cette activité en achetant par quantité plus nombreuse. Elle participe financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diénabou S. is an 38-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007 and has had six successive loans, which she has always repaid faithfully.  Diénabou sells fuel and lubricants in her village.  The village is quite far from the city, and people notice the lack of a gas station there, while the principal means of transportation is the motorbike.  Diénabou is deriving a profit from this situation in order to develop a small business for fuels and lubricants.  This loan will enable her to bolster this business through buying in greater quantities.  Financially, she is helping to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing her business involving fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Flor De San Antonio 2 Group

texts.es:
Reina G. H., es una persona casada, tiene 1 hijo , es trabajadora, y a pesar de su pobreza ella  ha salido adelante, con sus familia y su esposo, se dedica  a la confección  de prendas, como pants, playeras, y el producto que ella confecciona, lo venden en el mercado del municipio de San Francisco el alto del departamento de Totonicapán, y realiza una actividad doble porque también se dedica a la crianza de animales tales como cerdos, y vacas, y su punto de venta  de estos animales, es en el Paraje Pologuá, de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, municipio de San Momostenango,  Totonicapán . Ella necesita ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la crianza de animales, es el segundo crédito  que solicita en las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, para solicitar un segundo crédito y así  poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida la de su familia y contribuir en el crecimiento de la economía del país de Guatemala.

Estas señoras pertenecen al Paraje Xetux de la aldea San Antonio Sija Municipio de San Francisco el Alto departamento de  Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Reina G. H. is married and has a son. She is hard working and despite her poverty has gotten ahead with her family and husband. She makes clothing like pants and t-shirts. She sells the items she makes in San Francisco el Alto’s market in Totonicapán department. She has another occupation which consists in raising farm animals like pigs and cows. She sells these animals in Paraje Pologuá, San Antonio Pasajoc villaje, Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán. She needs to increase her animal raising activities. This is the second loan she has requested at ASDIR’s offices in Pologuá to finance her economic activity thereby improving her own and her family’s living conditions as well as contributing to Guatemala’s economic growth. These women are from Paraje Xetux, San Atnonio Sija village, San Francisco el Alto municipality, Totonicapán department.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba S. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 6 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de produits divers tels des légumes, des épices, et des condiments pour cuisine. Elle a installé un table en fortune dans le marche du village où elle mène son petit commerce. Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises et pouvoir ainsi accroître son activité. Elle participe à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba S. is a 54-year-old woman who is married and the mother of eight children.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007 and has received six successive loans.  She has always repaid her loans without a problem.  Coumba is developing a small business for various goods, such as vegetables, spices, and condiments.  She has set up a makeshift table at the village market where she runs her small business.  This loan will enable her to do better in stocking up on merchandise and thus to grow her business.  She is helping to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital in order to develop her business further

loans.name: Chivarretense 2 Group

texts.es: La señora Juana G. Ordóñez, tiene 4 hijos y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos tales como ganado Vacuno, porcino y bovino, y también crianza  de pollos ponedoras, y de engorde  y los vende en el mercado de la Aldea de Chivarreto los días miércoles, y en el mercado del municipio de San Francisco el Alto Departamento de Totonicapán, los días jueves a viernes ella  ha logrado logrado obtener buenos beneficios a todo lo que pueden emprender, por tal razón ellos con la iniciativa de incrementar sus capital de trabajo, decide formar un grupo y ampliar el capital de trabajo de cada una, y asi mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida. La coordinadora de este grupo ya ha tenido experiencia con prestamos y ha sido puntual en sus pagos para con esta institución ASDIR, y esta vez espera que los integrantes de este grupo puedan mejorar también sus condiciones de vida. Este grupo de personas son del Paraje Chichaj de la aldea Chivarreto del Municipio de San Francisco el Alto  del  departamento de  Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Juana G. Ordóñez has 4 children and a husband that helps her. She breeds animals, including cattle, pigs, laying hens and fattening poultry, and sells them at the market of the hamlet of Chivarreto and at the market of the municipality of San Francisco el Alto in the department of Totonicapán. Market day is Wednesday in the hamlet and Wednesday to Friday in the municipality. So far she has obtained a good profit in what she has undertaken; that's why she decided to create a loan group and help all other members to increase their working capital so as to improve their income and standard of living. This is the second loan requested by the group coordinator, who hopes that the group members will be able to improve their quality of life. The group memers are from Paraje Chichaj in the hamlet of Chivarreto, municipality of San Francisco el Alto, department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariela Yaquelin

texts.es:
la joven Mariela Yaquelin O. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, tiene una pulperia 
desde hace 3 años. sus clientes son vecinos de la comunidad y de los lugares aledaños.
nos comento que le a ido muy bien, el credito  lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia ya que necesita tener un mejor inventario y mas variedad de productos.
 
su mayor deseo es que su negocio sea el mejor de la zona y que sea el mas surtido para poder cubrir con las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mariela Yaquelin O., 22, is single and lives with her parents. She has had a grocery store for the last three years. Her customers are neighbors from her community and adjacent areas. She told us that she has done well and will use the loan to buy more stock items because she needs to have a better, more varied inventory of products. Her greatest wish is that her store be the best in the area, that it be the best stocked so that she can meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, tortillas, bread, sugar, rice, coffee, lard, cooking oil, corn flour, soups, candles, batteries, matches, powdered drink mixes, soap, churros, shampoo, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, salt, spices, eggs, condiments.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer muy esforzada, de edad de 57 años, tiene tres hijos, el cual  han trabajado junto con ella para pode salir  a delante ya que no tiene la ayuda de su compañero, ya que murió en la guerra de los setenta que se dio en Nicaragua, desde entonces comenzó a trabajar en sastrería aprendiendo, lo que con los años logro la experiencia.

Su negocio que tiene es la venta de zapatos y una pequeña farmacia que administran sus hijos. Cuando comienza la venta de zapato lo hizo con dinero de su liquidación de su trabajo y ayuda de su hijo mayor.
Vendiendo poco, lo que con los años requiere del financiamiento para invertir mas en productos variados. Ya que la demanda es mucha en el mercado.
Sus dificultades es que las ventas a veces por semanas están bajas, y solo gana para los gastos.
Así como hay fines de semana que se vende bastante, es por eso le gusta mover su capital en variedad de productos.

Con este préstamo lograra comprar zapatos, sandalias de joven y niñas en docenas para mejorar la inversión y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juana is a very hard working woman. She is 57 years old and has 3 children who work with her to help get ahead, since she does not have her husband's help. He died in the war in the 1970s in Nicaragua. After that she began working as a seamstress, learning as she went, and over the years she succeeded with experience. Her business is selling shoes and a small pharmacy that her children manage. When she began selling shoes she did it with the severance payment from her job and the help of her eldest son. Sales are slow and over the years she needs financing to invest more in product variety. There is a lot of demand in the market. The difficultly is that some weeks sales are low, and she only earns enough for expenses. There are also weekends when she sells a lot, and for this reason she would like to invest in having more product selection. With this loan she will be able to purchase shoes, children and girls' sandals by the dozen, to improve her investment and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and sandals to increase sales

loans.name: Wonto

texts.fr: Wonto B. est une femme de 63 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfant majeurs. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 06  reprises bénéficié de crédit et rembourse chaque fois régulièrement. Elle fait du petit commerce: elle vend sur une table en fortune du thé, du sucre et des condiments de cuisine. Son prêt lui servira à renforcer sa marchandise et développer son petit commerce. Ses bénéfices lui servent à se prendre en charge et a renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Wonto B. is a 63-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two adult children.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007 and has had a loan six times, and she has repaid them properly each time.  Wonto has a small business:  she sells tea, sugar, and condiments from a makeshift table.  Her loan will be used to enhance her stock of merchandise and to develop her small business.  Her profits will be used to support herself and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her investment capital

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
la señora Petronila A. A. tiene 53 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Francisco Garcia quien se dedica a la venta de pan y dulces en Langue, Valle.
la señora A. tambien compra verduras los dias sabados para venderla los domingos ya que es el dia que mas se vende por que las personas de otras comunidades vienen a comprar a esta zona,  tambien vende dulces y pasteles. el credito lo utilizara para comprar pan, dulces y verduras. 
Petronila tiene su propia casa y vive con sus dos hijos y su marido.
tienen como 29 años de edad de vivir en su casa.
su sueño es que sus hijos puedan graduarse y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petronila A. A. is 53 years old. She lives with her common-law husband Francisco Garcia, who sells bread and sweets in Langue, Valle. Mrs. A. also purchases vegetables on Saturdays to sell on Sundays, since that is the day when sales are highest, as people from other communities come to this area to shop. She also sells sweets and desserts. She will use the loan to purchase bread, sweets, and vegetables. Petronila has her own home and lives with her two children and her husband. They have lived in their house for 29 years. Her dream is that her children will graduate and be good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread, sweets, and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Fermina

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Fermina A. G. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Raul Nuñez Santos quien se dedica a la albañileria.
Tienen 2 hijos que estan en la escuela y son bien portados, viven en casa de los suegros y Maria se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, frescos, agua, hielo, granos basicos. esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado de Langue.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas surtido su negocio. 
su sueño es tener su propia casa, Maria es una persona muy amable y respetuosa,  le gusta quedar bien con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fermina A. G., age 36, lives in a common-law marriage with Raul Nuñez Santos. He works as a bricklayer. They have two children. The children are in school, and they are very well behaved. They live in her mother-and father-in law’s house. María sells grocery items, soft drinks, water, ice, and basic grains. She has been doing this for six years. Her business is located on the inside of the Langue Market. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise in order to stock her business more. Her dream is to have her own house. María is a very kind and respectful person. She likes to get along well with her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, coffe, bread, soft drinks, churros, soup, pasta, and salsas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is 53 years old and married to Raphael T. and they have three children: Fatuma (28 years old); David (25 years old) and Irene (20 years old). They live in Bungoma town.

Mary sells second-hand clothes at Bungoma market and her clients are people who go to the market to shop. She is applying for her 2nd loan from Kadet Ltd after repaying her first loan well.  She wants to use the money to buy 3 bales of used clothes to add to her stock.

Her hope and dream is to start selling ready-made clothes and to open a boutique.

loans.use: Buy 3 bales of used clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois d PAKOUR de le 30 décembre 2008 et y a reçu 05 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus, elle s'approvisionne dans la ville de Tambacounda, environs à 200 kilomètres et revend dans son village. Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter la quantité de tissus qu'elle achetait et prétendre à plus de bénéfices afin de mieux participer à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture, la santé, l'habillement et la scolarité.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a married, 48 year-old woman who is responsible for the care of two children. She has been a member of the Pakour Banc Villageois since December 30, 2008. She has repaid her previous five loans easily. She has a small fabric business. She stocks up in the city of Tambacounda, about 200 kilometers away, and then sells her products in her village. This loan will enable her to increase the amount of fabric that she buys. She aspires to increase her revenues to help meet the family's expenses for food, health, clothing and schooling.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Karla Danelia

texts.es:
La joven Karla tiene la edad de 25 años, con dos hermosos hijos, su esposo trabaja en una disco móvil junto con su papa.
Karla vende frutas y verduras ambulante desde hace varios años para lograr las mejoras de su familia.
Aun no cuenta con su propia casa, vive en casa de su suegra en un cuarto aparte de madera lo que le gustaría. Con los años, tener su propia casa para sus pequeños hijos.
Su negocio cuando inicio era la venta de ropa usada y cosmético pero no le fue tan bien ya que la gente muchas veces no le pagaba.
Es por eso decide invertir en frutas y verduras que es el alimento diario de los nicaragüense y de accesibles precios.
Con este préstamo quiere comprar un saco de papas, una caja de tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, pepinos, melón, naranja y otros para lograr vender mas y obtener mejores beneficios que ayuden a la alimentación y educación de sus hijos.
Contenta por que a través de este financiamiento lograra aumentar la inversión ya que trabaja con poco dinero.
texts.en:
Young Karla is 25 years old and has two beautiful children. Her husband works with her father as a mobile disk jockey.

Karla has been selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor for many years so that she can make life better for her family. She still does not own a home, so she lives at her mother-in-law’s house in a separate room made of wood that she likes. Within a few years, she hopes to have her own home for the sake of her two young children.

When she started her business, Karla sold used clothing and cosmetics. However, she did not do very well because too often her customers did not want to pay. For this reason, she decided to invest in fruits and vegetables which are an affordable daily source of food for Nicaraguans.

With this loan she wants to buy a sack of potatoes, a case of tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, cucumbers, melons, oranges, and other types of produce so that she can increase her sales and obtain more income to help feed and educate her children. Karla is glad that this loan will help increase investment into her business since she already works with little money.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Diarga

texts.fr: Diarga D. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THIANKANG depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 06 fois de suite reçu de crédit mais n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de sucre, de piment, d'oignon et de condiment pour la cuisine et se nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises. Son ambition est de participer financièrement à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Diarga D. is a widowed, 59 year-old woman who is responsible for the care of five children. She has been a member of the Thiankang Banc Villageois since June 1, 2007. She has easily repaid her six previous loans. She has a small business that sells sugar, peppers, onions and seasonings for cooking. This new loan will allow her to increase her stock of products. Her ambition is to contribute financially to improving her family's living conditions and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her small business

loans.name: Wilmer Orlando

texts.es:
el joven Wilmer Orlando C. M. tiene 25 años de edad, hace poco contrajo matrimonio, no tiene hijos y  vive en la casa de sus padres que esta ubicada en la aldea el Matiaral San Lorenzo, Valle.
Wilmer se dedica a la venta de achineria desde hace unos 3 años, de San Lorenzo viaja a El Salvador todos los dias a vender su producto.
Wilmer es una persona responsable y honesta, el credito lo utilizara en la compra de achineria.

su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa y ahi mismo poner una pequeña tienda en la cual venda diferentes productos.
quiere prepararse para cuando tenga sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilmer Orlando C. M. is 25 years old and newly married. They do not have any children yet, and they live in his parents' house in the village of Matiaral near San Lorenzo, Valle. Wilmer has worked selling a variety of merchandise for the last three years. He travels from San Lorenzo to El Salvador everyday to sell his products. Wilmer is a responsible and honest man. He will use the loan to purchase general merchandise. His dream is to have his own house and have a storefront in his home where he would sell different products. He wants to prepare a better life for when he has children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Hawa B. est une femme de 28 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THIANKANG depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 06 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit qu'elle a bien géré et remboursé régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce pâte d'arachide, oignons, de piment et d'autres condiments pour cuisine. Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son approvisionnement pour ces produits ci-dessus afin de mieux développer son petit commerce. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Hawa B. is a married, 28 year-old woman who has five children at home. She has been a member of the Thiankang Banc Villageois since June 1, 2007. She has managed her six previous loans well and repaid them. She has a small business that sells peanut paste, onions, peppers and other seasonings for cooking. She will use her loan to increase the supply of these products to improve her small business. She helps her husband in meeting the family expenses for food and health.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her business activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase leather, cowhide, iron and acid

loans.name: Hatou

texts.fr: Hatou D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PAKOUR depuis 30 décembre 2008. Elle a 03 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement sans difficulté. Elle fait un petit commerce et vend de l'arachide, de l'huile de palme et de la pâte d'arachide, ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement en marchandises et accroître son activité. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille en contribuant à la nourriture, la santé et au payement de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Hatou D. is 39. She is married with four children, all still at home. She has belonged to the Banc Villageois of Pakour since December 30, 2008. She has had three loans, all repaid without problems. She has a small business selling peanuts, palm oil and peanut butter, Her new loan will allow her to build her inventory and grow her business. She helps improve her family's standard of living by supporting their nutritional and health needs and by paying school fees for the children.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve ability to finance own activities

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Sonia es una mujer activa, trabajadora, con un  hijo de dos años, vive  en el  bario de la capital de Managua, Máximo Jerez.
Su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace cinco  años vende.
El cual comenzó con dinero de liquidación de su trabajo en zona franca.
Ambos su esposo el cual se ha esforzado para que su negocio aumente y lograr obtener mejores entradas económicas.

Su esposo se encarga de las ventas de tortilla el cual pagan a una joven que palmee las ricas tortillas que se venden en su misma casa.
Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como: quintal de frijoles, arroz, maíz, azúcar, bidón de aceite, potes de leche, papel higiénico, gaseosas, golosinas entre otros productos consumibles. 
Logrando así mejores ventas, clientes nuevos, mejor atención. Que gracias al financiamiento lograra el objetivo de aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Doña Sonia is an active and very hard-working woman with a 2 year old son. She lives in a suburb of the capital Managua, Máximo Jerez. She has a small grocery store which she has had for 5 years. Sonia began this business with money from a clearance sale from her work in the duty-free zone. Both Sonia and her husband have worked hard to grow the business and obtain better economic earnings. Sonia's husband takes charge of selling tortillas, and pays a young helper to form the delicious tortillas that they sell in their own home. With this loan they will invest in the purchase of basic grains such as: sacks of beans, rice, maize, sugar, cans of oil, jars of milk, toilet paper, soft drinks, and lollies, among other comestible products. In this way they hope to obtain better sales, new clients and better patronage. Thanks to this finance Sonia will achieve the objective of expanding her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, lollies, soft drinks, and milk to expand inventory

loans.name: Chiperez Group

texts.es:
Doña Octaviana A. L., es casada, tiene 3 hijos y 2 hijas, ella se dedica a la venta   pañuelos, y tapetes, que   ella  lo compra por mayoreo con los comerciantes  que viajan a los Estados Unidos, se tomo la idea de comercializar  este  tipo de producto en el mercado  de la Aldea de Chivarreto, y también, vende con los comerciantes que viajan a los diferentes municipios de Huehuetenango,  igualmente  se dedica a la crianza de cerdos blancos, y los vende en el mercado del municipio de San Francisco el Alto del departamento de Totonicapán,   ella es una persona entusiasta que  ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia  y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y juntamente los dos han logrado  aportar el gasto familiar. Han tomado la iniciativa de formar un grupo con el objetivo de solicitar un prestamos, para ampñliar su capital y estender su venta para tener mejores ganacias, así pueden mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una

Residen en el Paraje Chiperez, de la  aldea Chivarreto, del Municipio de San Francisco el Alto del departamento de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Doña Octaviana A. L. is married with 3 sons and 2 daughters. She works selling scarves and table clothes which she purchases from wholesalers who travel to the US. She took the idea of commercialising this type of product from the Aldea de Chivarreto market, and she also sells with the traders who travel to the different municipalities of Huehuetenango. Octaviana also breeds white pigs and sells them in the municipal market in San Francisco el Alto in the Totonicapán department. Octaviana is a very enthusiastic person who has managed to move her family forward and has the help of her husband who sells typical clothing. Together the 2 of them have managed to cover their family costs. They have taken the initiative to form a group with the objective of seeking a loan to amplify their working capital and extend their sales to obtain better earnings, and in this way improve the living conditions of each person. They live in Paraje Chiperez, in the area Chivarreto, in the municipality of San Fransisco el Alto, in the Totonicapán department.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
la sra Ana Luz G. A. tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada y tienen 1 hijo que esta pequeño.
Su esposo se dedica al comercio tambien, Ana tiene 8 años de tener su negocio de elaboracion de pasteles para todas ocaciones, tambien elabora piñatas, coronas y venta de golosinas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materia prima para elaborar pasteles.
Ana tiene casa propia y vive comodamente su mayor deseo es que sus ventas se mejoren y que su hijo no tenga problemas de salud en ningun momento.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Luz G. A. is 29 years old, married, and has a small child. Her husband also works as a merchant. For the past eight years, Ana has had a business making cakes for all occasions. In addition to selling sweets, she makes piñatas and wreaths.

This loan will be used to buy ingredients for making cakes. Ana has her own home and lives comfortably. Her greatest wish is to improve her sales and she hopes that her child does not experience any health problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making cakes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase various bicycle parts

loans.name: Gloria Consuelo

texts.es:
la señora Gloria Consuelo O. tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, vive  en la Caucara San Lorenzo, Valle.
tiene 3 años de vivir en esa zona.
se dedica junto con su esposo a la venta de achineria, negocio con el cual han construido su casa y han sacado adelante a sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia ya que sus clientes le estan pidiendo cada dia mas.
Gloria viaja a el Amatillo todos los dias en autobus para vender su mercaderia esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Consuelo O. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Caucara San Lorenzo, Valle. She has been in this area for three years.

Gloria and her husband work together selling various sundries. This business has enabled them to build a house and move their children forward. Her loan will be used to buy more merchandise that her customers demand. She travels to Amatillo every day by bus in order to sell her products. Gloria has been in this business for eight years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various sundries such as flashlights, toothpastes, reading glasses, watches, batteries, and antennas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pasaquiquim 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana Gregoria H. G. ,  su estado civil es soltera, por lo que es una persona con visión, porque se dedica a la confección de playeras, y cuenta con sus maquinas para realizar esta actividad, elabora 2 docenas de playeras al día, este producto es enviado al norte del país de Guatemala, en el departamento de Quiche, y Alta Verapaz,  ella se dedica también a la crianza de animales domésticos tales como Ganado porcino y vacuno, y lo vende en el mercado del municipio de San Francisco el alto del departamento de Totonicapán, y ella colabora con el gasto familiar, también aportan un granito de arena al desarrollo del país de Guatemala, por lo que se acercaron para solicitar un segundo crédito  así poder aumentar el capital de trabajo que tienen, juntamente con el grupo.

Este grupo de personas, del Paraje Pasquiquim, de la Aldea San Antonio Sija  del municipio de San Francisco el Alto  del  departamento de  Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Gregoria H. G. is single and a person with vision. She manufactures shirts and has the machines that are necessary for this business. Juana produces two dozen shirts per day and ships them to the northern part of Guatamala, specifically the departments of Quiche and Alta Verapaz. She also raises domesticated animals, such as pigs and cows, and sells them at the municipal market in San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán. She contributes toward the family expenses and does her small part in supporting the development of the Guatemalan economy. Juana and the rest of her group are requesting a second loan so that they can increase their operating capital.

These ladies are from Paraje Pasquiquim in the neighborhood of San Antonio, Township of San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Flor De San Antonio 1 Group

texts.es: Doña Elvira Lucia H. L., es casada, tiene 1 hijo y 2 hijas , es una persona  trabajadora, y a pesar D. su pobreza ella  ha salido adelante, con sus familia. Su esposo, se dedica  a la confección  D. prendas, como pants, playeras ella tambien confecciona; venden su producto en el mercado del municipio D. San Francisco el alto del departamento D. Totonicapán, realiza una actividad doble,  porque también se dedica a la crianza D. animales tales como cerdos, y vacas, y su punto D. venta  D. estos animales, es en la ciudad D. la aldea D. Chivarreto, del  municipio D. San Francisco el alto, del departamento D. ,  Totonicapán . Ella necesita ampliar su capital D. trabajo para la crianza D. animales, es el segundo crédito  que y así  poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y D. sus familias,  y apoyar en el crecimiento D. la economía del país. Este grupo D. señoras viven en el Paraje Xetux D. la aldea San Antonio Sija Municipio D. San Francisco el Alto departamento D.  Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Doña Elvira Lucia H. L. is married and has three children, a son and two daughters. She is a hardworking individual and, despite her poverty, has been able to get ahead with her family. Her husband manufactures garments, such as trousers and shirts. She also sews and sells her products at the market in the town of San Francisco el Alto in the Department of Totonicapán. Elvira also has a second business raising animals, such as pigs and cows, and selling them in the neighborhood of Chivarreto in the town of San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán. She needs to increase her operating capital for raising animals.

This is her second loan. By financing her business activity, she will be able to improve the living conditions for herself and her family and contribute toward the economic growth of the country. These group of ladies live in Paraje Xetux in the neighborhood of San Antonio Sija in the town of San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for raising animals

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou B. est âgée de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KABENDOU de puis le 22 janvier 2007 et a reçu 07 fois de suite de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle fait un petit commerce de graines d'arachide et de pâte d'arachide, son prêt lui permettra d'augmenter sa quantité d'approvisionnement en marchandises pour augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. Elle participe financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aissatou B. is 58 years old, married and the mother of four dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kabendou since January 22, 2007 and obtained loans seven times in the past, all repaid without issues. Her line of business is selling peanut seeds and peanut sauce. This loan will allow her to enlarge her stock and increase her income. Her financial contribution helps to improve the life conditions of her family

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business capital

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta S. est une femme de 24 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants et tutrice d'un enfant confié par un parent. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KABENDOU depuis le 27 juillet 2007 et a 14 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle achète des arachides à l'état brute, c'est-à-dire en gousse, elle les décortique, les grille avant de les transformer en pâte et vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans et en a acquière une bonne expérience. Avec son prêt elle va acheter de l'arachide pour continuer à faire cette activité qui lui procure des bénéfices lui permettant de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fanta S. is a 24-year old woman; she is married and the mother of four children, with one other child entrusted to her care by a relative. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kabendou since July 27, 2007 and obtained loans 14 times in the past. She prepares and sells peanut sauce. She purchases peanuts raw, that is to say still in their shells; she shells and roasts peanuts in order to prepare peanut paste and then sell it at the weekly market. She has been in this line of business for over five years and has accumulated a lot of experience. With this loan she would like to purchase a supply of peanuts in order to continue with this business which brings her an income allowing her to help improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and promoting her business activity

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KABENDOU depuis le 22 janvier 2007 et a reçu 07 fois de suite de crédit et remboursement toujours régulièrement. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle achète des arachides à l'état brute, c'est-à-dire en gousse, elle les décortique, les grille avant de les transformer en pâte et vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans et en a acquière une bonne expérience. Avec son prêt elle va acheter de l'arachide afin de poursuivre son activité. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mariama D. is a 30-year old woman, married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kabendou since January 22, 2007 and obtained loans seven times in the past, always repaying them on schedule. She prepares and sells peanut paste. She purchases peanuts raw, that is to say in their shells; she shells and grills the peanut in order to prepare peanut paste to be sold at the weekly market. She has been in this line of business for over five years and has accumulated a lot of experience. With this loan she would like to purchase a supply of peanuts in order to continue with this business. She contributes to improving the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business capital

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna S. est une femme de 25 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KABENDOU depuis le 22 janvier 2003, elle a une expérience de plus de 08 ans dans son domaine d'activité qui consiste la transformation et vente de "nététou". Le nététou est un produit alimentaire local qui est fabriqué à partir de fruits d'arbre sauvage. Elle achète ces fruits d'arbre en brousse et fait la transformation elle même et la vente est faite dans un grand marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Maïmouna S. is a 25 year old woman, she is married and mother of 3 children in her charge. She is member of the Village Bank of KABENDOU since January 22, 2003, she has over 8 years experience in her field of activity which consists of the processing and sale of "nététou". The nététou is a local food product which is manufactured starting from fruits of wild trees. She buys these fruits in the surrounding countryside and processes it herself. She sells in a large weekly market in her locality. Her objective is to take part financially in the responsibilities of her family while reinforcing her level of saving.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her capital and grow her small business

loans.name: Mataiumu

texts.en:
Mataiumu L. is 42 years old. She is married and has 7 children (ages 8 - 25).  She owns a business planting, harvesting, and selling a variety of vegetables. Mataiumu has 4 years of experience in this business.  

Mataiumu needs a loan of 2000 WST to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Mataiumu joined SPBD. This is her 7th loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mataiumu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. To receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD, please join SPBD's lending team at  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375.
